She currently sells food and began her business on her own initiative with only a little money.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy rice, potatoes and noodles from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz.  Afterwards, she will sell the goods at her food stall.  This job allows her to earn enough income to support her household, since she lives with her common-law husband and two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the training regarding health and credit.

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes and noodles.

loans.name: Sériba

texts.fr:
Né en Octobre 1960 à Tinzanadougou préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Sériba est marié et père de 7  enfants, il réside avec ses deux épouses et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Monsieur Sériba après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié à l’achat de bétail il y’a environ 9 ans. Il mène cette activité au marché à bétail  du nouveau marché  de Médine où il vend des moutons, chèvres, etc.. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son bétail. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui  il est à son troisième prêt individuel..
Il sollicite ce troisième prêt individuel pour acheter 20 petits ruminants dans les localités environnantes qui sont entre autres (Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.) auprès des éleveurs
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Sériba was born in October 1960 in Tinzanadougou in the prefecture of Sikasso. He is married and father to seven children, and he lives with his two wives and their children in a large traditional family in Sanoubougou 1, one of the working-class districts of the town on Sikasso.

After several unsuccessful business ventures, Sériba began buying livestock about nine years ago. He carries out this activity at the new livestock market in Médine where he sells sheep, goats etc..He is in great demand from his customers for the quality of his livestock. In order to satisfy the demand of his ever-growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his third individual loan.

He is requesting this third individual loan to buy 20 small ruminants from breeders in the surrounding towns, including Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro, Barrage etc.

With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 90,000FCFA, which will be used to expand his business, contribute to family expenses and repay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en:
This is Celestino, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Helen, his business partner, and they have children. At this time, Celestino is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Celestino oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business. They have one unit of Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits every day. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Celestino dreams of having more jeepneys and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney unit.

loans.name: Cheny

texts.en:
Cheny is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol, and the mother of a three-year-old son. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of their income.

Cheny is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. She dreams of expanding her business in the future and making it sustainable and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her son and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza is 41 years old. She is a humble businesswoman who works as a grocer. She is a Kiva client. She tells us that her past loan was a great help because it allowed her to make her business grow by buying more products that she didn't have in her inventory, like sugar, beans, cosmetics and underwear. The goal was to obtain a better income and to be able to continue growing her business. Now she needs financing to buy basic items such as sugar, rice, oil, bread, bleach, etc. The goal is to continue supplying her store with new products and to keep up with customer demand.

loans.use: to buy basic items such as sugar, rice, oil, bread and bleach.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 55 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a flowers-for-sale business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 6 years and earns about 15,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GMPC in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure for her flowers and seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for her flowers and seedlings.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is a 50-year-old fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of five children. He has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income which he uses for the needs of his family and for the school expenses of his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Helenore

texts.en:
Helenore is 37 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 5 years and earns about 35,000PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2012 and now she has requested a loan of 43,000PHP to purchase tires and spare parts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman and a mother of three children. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat. In the future, Elsa dreams of making their fishing venture a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of five children. She earns a living through her retailing business. She buys and sells various goods like clothing and even farm products like bananas, potatoes and others. Her husband works as a farmer.

Demetria is asking for a loan to buy additional to stock to sell like ready-to-wear clothes. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and eventually her sales.

loans.use: to buy additional to stock to sell like ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is 51 years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business as a primary source of income. She wants to promote their living through her business but she has insufficient capital. She just earns P5,000 each disposing time which she utilizes for their daily necessities, so she hopes to increase her sales. 

She is asking for a loan amount of P5,000 to buy vitamins for her current hogs and one new hog as an additional source of sales. She hopes that through her hard work and this loan amount, she can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for her current hogs and one new hog.

loans.name: La Merveille Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida est conseillère du groupe La Merveille, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 50 ans,  mariée et mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est sans emploi, toute fois, il réalise de petites commissions, pas du tout régulière, pour la survie de leur ménage. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires (maïs) dans un entrepôt à Birere. Il commença avec son fonds propre, que son fils ainé lui avait donné. Il ya plus de 6 ans, elle fait cette affaire. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 45 sacs de maïs. L’insécurité dans le zone d’approvisionnement constitue un défi pour elle. Elle souhaite acheter une grande parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.
texts.en:
Mrs. Faida, an energetic entrepreneur, is the advisor of La Merveille Group. She's 50 years old, married, and the mother of six school-attending children. Her husband is unemployed, but he occasionally takes odd jobs to keep their household afloat.

Mrs. Faida sells food products (corn) in a warehouse in Birere. Six years ago, she started this business with her own funds, given to her by her eldest son.

This new loan will be used to buy 45 sacks of corn. Insecurity in her supply area is a challenge for her. She would like to buy a large lot of land and educate her children. In the end, she thanks Kiva's partner, Hekima, for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy 45 sacks of corn

loans.name: Amca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMCA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas de hilo, elaboración de colchones, tienda de barrio, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años comenzando con la comercialización de carne de oveja y posteriormente paso al ganado vacuno.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las ferias la comunidad de Batallas, ciudad de La Paz, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta el ahorro y las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “AMCA” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Copacabana center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Margarita is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are: weaving blankets, making matresses, a neighborhood store and selling food.  

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro business women, among whom is Margaret. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a butcher shop. She reports that she started this business years ago selling mutton and later began to sell beef. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital, buying meat she will acquire in the markets of the community of Batallas, city of La Paz, to later sell in her locale. This work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible, because she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the health and credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 44, has a shop in the community of Paragu, where she lives with her partner and their four children. In the shop she sells retail items like groceries, snacks, soda, meat, dairy, etc. which she buys wholesale at the best deals in the town where she lives. 

The business is run by Victoria from 6 am to 9 pm every day, selling items on credit and more commonly for cash. Her main customers are housewives and in general, neighbors, who buy retail items and products that they need for household consumption. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to Php 10,000, with which she plans to increase the stock in her store, buying discounted products (staple items) like rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar, milk, etc. that will help her to have an assorted inventory and to manage competitive prices.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar and milk for her store.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur MAMADOU est né vers 1964 à Lofigué Cercle de Kadiolo. Père de cinq  enfants et marié à une femme, il vit dans une famille nucléaire à  KADIOLO - NOUMOUSSO (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités d’achat et de vente de chaussures en plastique depuis plus de 6 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes venant de divers horizons. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il  sollicite la collaboration de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt.. 
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 600 paires de chaussures en plastique. Il s’approvisionne en République de Côte D’Ivoire pays frontalier du MALI. Acheminées au MALI, il  les revend au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au marché de Kadiolo et Loulouni. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Mamadou was born around 1964 in Lofigué, Kadiolo circle. Married and the father of 5 children, he lives in a nuclear family in Kadiolo - Noumousso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been buying and selling plastic shoes for over 6 years. His experience in this line of work has earned him a good reputation and he gets orders from everywhere. He is therefore asking for support from the microfinance institution Soro Wiriwaso in order to have the resources necessary to satisfy his customers, and is on his first loan. This loan will enable him to buy 600 pairs of plastic shoes. He gets his supplies from the Republic of the Ivory Coast, a country bordering Mali. When the shoes get to Mali, he sells them at the markets of Kadiolo and Loulouni, for cash and often credit, to a clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 105 000 francs. Part of the profit will allow him to cover the interest payments on his loan, and part will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Reymoor

texts.en:
Reymoor is 31 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a farm to earn a living, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community. He has been with his business for over 3 years and earns about 20,000PHP every month.

He joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Now he has requested a loan of 25,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 34 years now. This is the source of their income. She is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. In the future, Erlinda hopes to augment their income so that they can provide the needs of the family.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: 17 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “17 DE ABRIL”  iniciará el vigésimo  sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, producción de mantas, venta de verduras, venta de comida, tejido de ropa de bebe, taller de blusas, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz, posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “17 DE ABRIL” [17th April] communal bank is starting its 26th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It has nine members and is run by a board of directors with Hilaria as President. The members’ businesses are varied and include: blanket weaving, making blankets, selling vegetables, selling food, weaving baby clothes, blouse workshop, selling clothes.

The loan they take out will benefit small micro-companies, with which Hilaria is involved. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. At present she has a business selling fruit. She explains that she started this business on her own initiative.

The loan that she will receive is to increase her capital (to purchase fruit) which she will buy from the wholesale sellers in La Paz city. Subsequently, she will sell the produce from her stall. This kind of work enables her to generate income to help maintain her family, as she is married with four children. 
When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she replies that likes it and she likes the training workshops on health and loans.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es: El joven Bismark, casado tiene una hija, habita en el populosa Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su familia. sus planes a futuro es poder terminar su casa y darle asi un hogar digno a su hija. el es comerciante de Zapatos negocio del cual a sacado provecho ya que con las ganancias que obtiene va invirtiendo en su casa. con este credito comprara paca de Zapatos de segunda par ir a vender a los departamneto del pais. Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Bismark, a young man, is married and has a daughter. He lives with his family in the crowded district of Juan Ramón Padilla, Ticuantepe municipality. His plan is to finish building his house in order to give his daughter a decent place to live.

Bismark sells shoes, an activity that has been fruitful for him and that has left him profits to invest in his house. With this loan he will buy a bale of used shoes to sell in different regions of the country. He appreciates the help that AFODENIC and Kiva have given him.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Aymaritas De Julian Apaza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AYMARITAS DE JULIAN APAZA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, carpintería, venta de productos medicinales, artesanía en awayo, tejido de polainas, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó con el apoyo de su amiga, la que le enseñó esta técnica.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “AYMARITAS DE JULIAN APAZA” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Panamericana center. It is made up of six members and is led by a board of directors where Teodora is the member. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. among them are: weaving blankets, carpentry, selling medicinal products, Awayo artisanal products, weaving leggings, and a neighborhood store.  

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, among whom is Teodora. She indicates that this is the first the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a business weaving blankets. She reports that she started this business with the help of a friend, who taught her this technique. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying wool she will acquire in distribution stores in the city of La Paz to later use for production and sale in her locale. This work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible, because she is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 50 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a barbeque business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 8 years and earns about 50,000PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008 and now she has requested a loan of 60,000PHP to purchase additional barbeque to sell, like pork and chicken meat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional barbeque to sell, like pork and chicken meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for electrical wiring.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 33-year-old woman who has engaged herself in a sari-sari (variety) store. It serves as their everyday source of income. This causes her to want to further develop her business. Now, she is asking for a loan amount of P8,000 to buy grocery items such as breads, cooking oil, sugar, spices and coffee. She hopes this will attract more customers and might be a big help in increasing her net income. Then she could continue to send her two children to school. She is looking for the progress of her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as breads, cooking oil, sugar, spices and coffee.

loans.name: Lala Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame  LALA LEMOU a 47 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs sept  enfants  à Noumousso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Kadiolo ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame LALA LEMOU  fait la commercialisation de boubous bazins teintés et d’encens il y’a plus de 10 ans. Elle mène son activité dans sa famille au quartier Noumousso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a sollicité l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et est à son  9 eme  cycle maintenant.   
Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter  20 pièces de pagnes bazins (riche – moins riche), 10kg de graines de “magnon kisenin - gueunnin” et 15 bouteilles de parfums à Bamako. Après teinture et couture des pagnes bazins les boubous sont vendus. De même que les graines et parfums après transformation  en encens sont vendus. Elle les vend au comptant et à crédit à Kadiolo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile et de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Lala Lemou is 47 years old and lives with her husband and their 7 children in Noumousso, one of the popular districts of Kadiolo town (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Lala Lemou has been selling dyed damask boubous (long, loose-fitting African garments) and incense for over 10 years. She runs her business with her family in the Noumousso district, where her products are highly sought after by her clientèle because of their quality.

In order to satisfy her ever-growing clientèle, she has requested a loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on her 9th loan cycle. Her loan will enable her to buy 20 pieces of damask pagnes (colourful and decorative West African cloth) of varying quality, 10 kgs of “magnon kisenin - gueunnin” grains and 15 bottles of perfume in Bamako. After she has dyed the pagnes and made them into boubous, she sells them, and she also sells the incense once she has made it from the grains and perfume. She sells her products for cash or credit in Kadiolo, door-to-door and on the street, to a clientèle made up of men and women. Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average monthly profit of 150 000 francs, a large part of which will be used to increase her business, and the rest of which will go towards covering the family expenses and the interest payments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of damask pagnes, 10 kgs of “magnon kisenin - gueunnin” grains and 15 bottles of perfume.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa, a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol, has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for almost 4 years. This is their main source of income. She needs a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this loan Nelfa and her husband will be able to improve their business. 

Moreover, Nelfa wants to save money for the future schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassine est né en 1975 à BAMAKO. Père de 2 enfants il vit dans une famille nucléaire à Noumousso - Kadiolo (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène une activité de commercialisation de céréales et de produits alimentaires depuis six ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et il reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il décide de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son septième cycle  tous  les prêts passés se sont  correctement dénoués.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne d’arachide. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kadiolo. Les produits sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 110.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Lassine was born around 1975 in Bamako. Married and the father of 2 children, he lives in a nuclear family in Noumousso, Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been buying and selling cereals and food products for 6 years. His experience in this line of work has earned him a good reputation and he receives orders for cereals, particularly corn. He therefore decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to have the resources necessary to satisfy his customers, and is on his 7th loan cycle. The previous loans have been correctly reimbursed.

This loan will enable him to buy 5 tons of corn and one ton of groundnuts. He gets his supplies from the neighbouring villages in Kadiolo, and stores the products in his shop. He sells them for cash to a clientèle made up of men and women from Sikasso and Bamako. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 110 000 francs. Part of the profit will allow him to cover the interest payments on his loan, and part will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy 5 tons of corn and one ton of groundnuts.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married mother of three, who works hard to support her family.

She has a business which sells purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Leonila is borrowing PHP10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to build an auto parts supply store in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of water for resale.

loans.name: Gleezel

texts.en:
Gleezel works hard to support her family. She is married and has two children.

Gleezel is borrowing PHP 1400 through NWTF to purchase a cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her business. Gleezel is aware that by using the cookstove she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cookstove

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en: Edralyn is 37 years old and is engaged in buying and selling vegetables as a source of income. She has been doing this for four years and earns an average amount of PHP 5,000 every month. This isn’t sufficient for the education of her four children. Edralyn wishes to increase her monthly income, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional goods to sell such as squash, beans, onions, ginger, and garlic. This could help her earn a higher income, which she would use for the education of her children as well as to raise their current living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as squash, beans, onions, ginger, and garlic

loans.name: Mylyn

texts.en: Mylyn, age 32, works hard to provide for her family. She is engaged in a buying and selling business as a source of income. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables such as potatoes, spices, okra and squash to sell. She is hoping for a higher income this time. Mylyn aspires to save enough money for the education of her four children.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables such as potatoes, spices, okra, and squash to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
This loan will help Mohammad recover lost income caused by Hurricane Sandy.

When Mohammad moved from Bangladesh to the United States in 1994, he was blown away by how much it cost him to call his family back home: $3.40 per minute. Realizing the demand for lower international calling rates, Mohammad began Dhaka Telecommunications Corp, a business that provides grocery and convenience stores with calling cards at wholesale prices. While Mohammad sells cards for all international calls, he offers an especially low rate of $0.04 per minute to place calls to Bangladesh.

His business was successful until Hurricane Sandy struck New York. His clients, also harmed by the storm, have not been able to pay him back in full, and Mohammad isn’t able to purchase the inventory he needs to meet the demands from other clients. 

Stuck with pending invoices, Mohammad is looking for a loan to make up for lost income caused by the storm. This loan will help Mohammad recover from Hurricane Sandy, and also build a company website so he can begin directly selling to customers and operating more independently.

loans.use: To recover income loss from Hurricane Sandy and to build a website.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This loan will help Sarah advance her photography career.

Sarah has always had a passion for art. While the New Jersey native began photography simply as a hobby, the more she pursued her new craft, the more compliments she received. In 2011, Sarah began her own professional photography business, capturing weddings, maternity sessions and engagement parties. 

With the launch of her own website and after being promoted on Livingsocial.com, Sarah’s young business is booming and she hopes that through her art she can inspire and motivate other women to launch their own companies. Sarah has future plans to offer photography lessons, in addition to expanding her own portfolio.

Sarah needs a loan to purchase a new lighting system and a lens to help her take her craft to the next level. Sarah will also use the loan to purchase advertising and new marketing materials to attract more clients.

View Sarah’s photography at her website:  www.VibrantImagePhotography.com

loans.use: To purchase a new lighting system, a new lens, and to pay for marketing materials and advertising.

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
Amia is a 46-year-old married woman from Corella, Bohol. She has nine children. Her husband's income as a welder is not sufficient for the family's daily expenses.

She engages in a buy and sell business.She buys and sells firewood and charcoal. She has been doing this for three years.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to acquire more capital to buy firewood and charcoal. Amia would like expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. 

Margie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 62 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

He owns and operates a banana plantation in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over nine years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC in 2011 and now he had requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a mother of three children who engages in buying and selling vegetables. She is patiently doing such activity because she wants to improve their lifestyle.  

With over five years in this business, she has learned to save because she has realized the importance of preparing the future. 

Currently, she is requesting additional working capital in the amount of 6,000 pesos to purchase bananas, string beans and pechay (a type of cabbage). Sally is hoping for higher income with her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, string beans and pechay.

loans.name: Nicelin

texts.en:
Nicelin is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from  Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. 

Nicelin is applying for a loan to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. With this, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and enhance his catch.

loans.use: to buy nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has gained five years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Jocelyn is the mother of four children. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 38 years old and married to a farmer. She operates a business selling bananas and earns 150 PHP every day that she uses to cover her daily expenses. This amount is very minimal.

Everlyn is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more bananas. She hopes that her loan will help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and has seven children. Pacita is married and has no children who are in school.

Pacita is in the agricultural business farming/selling bananas in the Philippines. Pacita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Pacita has been farming/selling bananas for 12 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Magdalena aims to improve her hog-raising business and generate sufficient income. She is now 48 years old and has been gifted with four children. She and her husband are striving hard to satisfy their necessities and finance the education of their children. She plans to raise more pigs for sale but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional capital of P 20,000 to buy the needed feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. In the future, she is hoping that she will improve the business and their status of living as well.

loans.use: to buy the needed feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: To make a living, Lea has been engaged in a piggery business for over two years. Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide their daily needs. Lea is 25 years old, married, and has three children. She wants to expand her family business. That’s why she is taking out this loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase feed and vaccine for her hogs. Despite the hardships of life, she is striving to earn and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 30 years old and married with no children yet. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over two years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2009 and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like coffee, sugar and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like coffee, sugar and canned goods

loans.name: Srey Nat

texts.en:
Srey Nat is 34 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband sells pork. He earns about $5 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey Nat requests a loan of $500 to purchase more pork for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farmland and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pork for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Group

texts.es: Doña Martha, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Martha, juntamente con 16 socias mas trabajan por varios años en su propio negocio de una tienda de conveniencia ubicada en la comunidad donde venden productos de la canasta básica familiar, sandalias, productos de belleza, abarrotes, etc. Ahora han decidido formar un grupo de 8 personas para solicitar un préstamo en ODEF, el grupo se llama Mujeres Trabajando, que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta doña Martha Lidia tiene blusa color Ocre, seguido esta Gladis de blusa rosado, Lenis con blusa blanca, María Angelina con blusa café, María de la Cruz con blusa rojo con negro, María Mercedes blusa roja y María Norma blusa blanco con negro y a la derecha esta doña Blanca con blusa amarilla. Cada miembro del grupo esta solicitando 14,000 lempiras, haciendo un total grupal de 112,000 lempiras. El préstamo lo han solicitado para comprar un terreno donde construirán una pequeña granja avícola. Para este negocio están recibiendo el apoyo de una institución quien les dará un capital semilla y asesoría técnica para iniciarlo. Doña Martha tiene como meta a futuro poder mejorar su casa y ayudar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha, age 48, is a single mother, and she has one child.  She lives in the Tocoa municipality in Colon.  Martha, together with 16 other members, has worked for several years in her own business, a convenience store, which is located in the community.  They sells basic needs products, sandals, beauty products, and groceries, etc.

They have now decided to form a group of eight people in order to request a loan from ODEF.  The group is called Mujeres Trabajando (Women Working).  In the photo Martha Lidia is on the left and has on an ochre colored blouse.  Gladis, wearing a pink blouse, is next.  Then, there is Lenis in a white blouse, María Angelina in a brown blouse, María de la Cruz in a red and black blouse, María Mercedes in a red blouse, María Norma in a white blouse with black, and Blanca is on the right in a yellow blouse.

Each member of the group is requesting 14,000 lempiras, making a total of 112,000 lempiras.  They have requested the loan to buy land where they will build a small poultry farm.  They are receiving help for their business from an institution that will give them seed money and technical assistance in order to start it.

Martha’s goal for the future is to be able to improve her house and to help her child.

loans.use: to buy land where they will build a small poultry farm.

loans.name: Gimena Lincena

texts.es: La  Sra. Gimena tiene 23 años,  Gimena se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en la localidad de  Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Gimena va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes como quinua, arroz por mayor para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Gimena va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela, La  Sra. Gimena se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Gimena is 23 years old. Gimena works in the sales of a variety of staples such as groceries, sweets, soft drinks, and a variety of items in her neighborhood store that is located in Batallas. This loan is her first sequence through the institution.

Gimena is going to use this loan for the purchase of a variety of grocery items, such as quinoa and rice, wholesale to supply her business and therefore provide a variety of products to her customers. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving her business. Gimena is going to use the profits to continue buying products and therefore improve her income since this is the time of high demand. 

Her wish for her business is to have a grocery store to therefore provide a better service to her clientele. Gimena is happy for the opportunity provided since this is the only activity that allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy quinoa and merchandise.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 37ans, Jeanne est mère de 02 enfants tous à l’école. Le premier a 14ans et le dernier 10ans. Afin de mieux prendre soin de ses enfants, elle a démarré la vente des robes et chemises  en tissu batique de façon ambulante.  Manquant de fonds pour acheter en quantité considérables les robes et les chemises, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle souhaite disposer d’une boutique afin d’installer ses marchandises et bien suivre l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A young 37-year-old woman, Jeanne is the mother of two children both in school: The eldest is 14 and the youngest 10 years old. 

To take better care of her children, she started selling dresses and shirts made from batik fabric as a street vendor. Lacking funds to purchase significant quantities of dresses and shirts, she is requesting a first credit loan from WAGES to achieve her objective. 

Her future goal is to have a shop to display her goods so she can closely follow the education of her children.

loans.use: Buy shirts and dresses

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old, married, and thankful for having three children. Her family is her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and will allow her to support her children. She has had a retail store based in their home for four years. The daily net profit of 500 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. Thus she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from retailing. She also has raised pigs for 10 years. 

To improve her income in the store, Teresita is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other cooking ingredients. She will also buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. Teresita says the loan will be very helpful in the success of her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other cooking ingredients

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support six children. She is 43 years old and married.

Mercedita requested a PHP 1,400 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer and the Envirofit cookstove needs less fuel to cook food.

Mercedita is aware that by using the cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna is 28 years old. She is single and lives with her mother and sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her mother is a vegetable vender who makes an income of $3 per day. Her sister is also employed in a garment factory. She earns about $3 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Phanna requests a loan of $1200 to purchase timber and zinc to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop to make more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to rebuild her house

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Doña Rosa reside en la cuidad de Masaya, conocida también como cuidad de las flores,  con 29 años de edad, comerciante, su núcleo familiar lo componen su esposo y dos niñas menores de edad estudiantes de primaria.

Su negocio consiste en una pequeña venta de gaseosas y otros productos como ropa de varón, de mujer y niños.
 Este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño capital y con el propósito de colaborar con los ingresos del hogar ya que la familia había aumentado con las dos niñas y con solo el trabajo de su esposo no alcanzaba para el sustento de toda la familia.

 en esto momentos ya las niñas están en edad escolar y su educación demanda mayor gasto para la familia. La compra de la gaseosas se la entregan en su casa, pasa la empresa distribuidora y la compra para la venta de ropa las realiza en el mercado oriental, cuidad de Managua a la que tiene que viajar 

Actualmente  decidió adicionalmente  elaborar almuerzos para mejorar sus ingreso  y esta captando clientes por lo que en estos momentos   necesita invertirle a su negocio  por lo que esta solicitando un financiamiento que le  ayude con la demanda que es esta teniendo.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of Masaya, known as the City of Flowers.  She is twenty-nine years old, is a tradeswoman, and her family is made up of her husband and two young daughters who are both studying in primary school. 

Her business consists of a small trade in selling carbonated beverages and other products, like men's, women's and children's clothing.  She began this business with a little capital and with the purpose of contributing to her home's income; the family had grown with two daughters and her husband's work was not enough to maintain the entire family.

Presently, the girls are of school age and their education demands a larger expense for the family.  The carbonated beverages she orders are delivered to her house when the distributer company passes by, and the buying that she does for her clothing sales is done in the Eastern market, which is located in the city of Managua; she has to travel to get there.  She recently decided to additionally make lunches in order to grow her income, and she is attracting clients. 

For these reasons, she needs to invest in her business; this is why she is requesting financing that will help her with the demand of her store.

loans.use: to buy personal-size Coca Cola bottles, Big Cola in 360mL bottles, Big Cola in 500mL bottles, Coca Cola in 500mL bottles, Coca Cola in liter bottles, women's and men's pants, varied women's blouses, unisex children's outfits, and men's shirts.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and all three children are in school.

Riza is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Riza has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is an industrious wife and a mother of seven. She is helping her husband in providing the needs of her family through buying and selling bananas. She has been in the business for over ten years and it helps a lot in her family. 

Janeth wants to increase her sales, so she can cover their daily household expenses and save for the allowances of her children. Now, she is requesting PHP 7,000 to buy more bananas for sale. She hopes to earn more in order to save enough funds for the education of her children. She is focused on the future, especially in terms of her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 31-year-old lady living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs his own barber shop and his daily income is not enough for the family. Farzana is a tailor by profession and she provides tailoring services in her community. She is also a hardworking and responsible housewife who tries to combine her professional demands with fulfilling her family's needs on time. 

Farzana is requesting a loan to purchase one more sewing machine for her tailoring business. Her loan will help to increase her business and net income. Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena is 51 years old and married with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than seven years and earns 30,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2008.

Efrena has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soap and rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soap and rice.

loans.name: Concepcion Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Concepcion tiene la edad de 49 años, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de cuajada, crema y queso en el mercado municipal desde hace 17 años.

 ella se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven, ya que su mama de igual forma se dedico a la elaboración de cuajadas.

El objetivo de doña Concepción es comprar poco a poco unas vacas y de esta forma sus ingresos mejoran, ya que no tendrá que comprar la leche. 

por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una vaca parida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Concepción, 49, is single and has four adult children. She has been selling cream, curd and cheese in the local market for seventeen years.

Concepción was young when she started this business, an activity that she inherited from her mother. Her goal is to buy cows, one at the time, in order to improve her income, since she would not have to buy the milk from others. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a calved cow.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Señor Teodoro es soltero, tiene 41 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de cursar ni un año en la escuela, el se dedica al comercio, inicio este negocio trbajando con sus tios y hasta la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para ampliar su venta, en el futuro el quiere ver su negocio mas grande para poder brindarle mejores oportunidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro is single. He is 41 years old. He did not have the opportunity to attend even one year of school. He works in commerce. He began this business working with his uncles and now has 25 years of experience in the business. 

He is requesting a loan that he will utilize for the purchase of merchandise to expand his business. In the future, he wants to see his business be larger to be able to provide better opportunities to his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 44 years old and married with three children. She earns a living with her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Angelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelita has been in the pig-fattening business for three years and also earns additional income from direct selling of Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mae Angelene

texts.en:
Mae Angelene is 20 years old and married with one child. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store and is thankful for the 2,000 PHP income she earns each month. Mae Angelene uses her profit for her family's daily expenses and allowances. 

Mae Angelene is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase bread, noodles, biscuits, and spices as additional products to offer and increase her income. In the future, she's hoping to save money for her family and for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase bread, noodles, biscuits and spices

loans.name: Tabassum's Group

texts.en:
Tabassum is married and has two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a government employee and cannot meet the day-to-day needs of the family, so she developed a business to fulfill the needs of her family and children. Tabassum has a small tailoring business which is very much admired in surrounding communities. She is seen raising her hand in this picture. 

Tabassum is requesting a loan to purchase new sewing machines and some other accessories such as thread, pins, and other materials to complete her work in a short span of time. In the future, she plans to use the profit from her loan to help establish a small shop in the market and promote her business in nearby places.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and accessories for her work

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a 60-year-old who has been engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables for 25 years. She usually earns 700 PHP (Philippines pesos) within two market days, but this is not enough to provide for the needs of her family. She wishes to improve her business through a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to buy bananas, eggplant and string beans as additional goods to sell. She hopes to gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplant and string beans.

loans.name: Estrellas De Mercedario Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE MERCEDARIO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de jugos de linaza, pintura de madera, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, elaboración de joyas, costura de chamarras, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior, posteriormente decide establecer su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite y fideo) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Estrellas de Mercedario" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Point of Collpani.  The group is made up of eight members and is led by a committee of directors, of which Cristina is the president.  The members' businesses are varied, and include: selling linseed juice, painting wood, having a neighborhood store, selling food, making jewelry, sewing jackets, and sewing knapsacks.  The loan that they receive will benefit the small micro-businesses.  

Cristina is one of the beneficiaries.  She says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer, becoming a member through the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the institution.  Presently, she has a business selling food.  She says that she learned this business from a previous job; later, she decided to establish her own business.

The loan that she will take out now is to grow her capital by buying rice, oil, and noodles.   She will buy these items in the wholesale stores in the city of La Paz.  After making the foods, She will then sell them in the city of El Alto.  This form of work allows her to generate the resources she needs to maintain her home; she lives with her her partner and has a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married and has a business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her child. 

Catherine is requesting an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a solar lamp to use as an emergency light. She is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and married with children. She and her family own their own home. For the past 12 years, Myrna has been selling pigs. She chose this line of work to help her husband to cover their household expenses and provide their children with better financial stability. She used her previous loan to buy animals and increase her profits and cover many household expenses.

Myrna is requesting a loan to buy pigs to raise and pig feed. In the future, she hopes to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 52 years old and married with three children. For the past five years, she has been fattening pigs in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Cresilda is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old and married with two children, neither of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has been selling firewood in the Philippines. Dina works very hard to provide for her children.

Dina is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 41 years old and is a fighter committed to improving her family’s economic situation. She says she never stops and vows, that as long as she has her health, she will have more than enough reasons to continue in her trade. Julieta says emotionally, “I love my work, because thanks to it my family has food and a roof that shelters us from the sun and the rain.” Julieta is not in the best of health, which sometimes has prevented her from working. However, after she recovers, she returns to her work with renewed spirit.  

Julieta is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to restart her sewing business, fill pending orders, and cover household necessities. She hopes that with this loan her economic situation will improve and she will be able to pay for the medicines that she needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed to restart her sewing business

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a responsible housewife who has engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 40 years old and has three school-age children. With her husband, she aims to improve their status of living and continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and find a good job someday. 

In this regard, Aurelia aims to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income. She is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy feeds, vitamins and more piglets to raise. Through this financial assistance, she is hoping that someday, she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Diosdada is 57 years old and has two children who are in school.

Diosdada has an electronic load (phone credits) business in the Philippines. Diosdada requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional amounts of electronic load to sell.

Diosdada has been in this business for four years. In the future, Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional amounts of electronic load (phone credits) to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 57 years old and married with five children.

Matilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sardines, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

Matilde has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Matilde aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sardines, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 45-year-old married woman with two children — one boy and one girl. She has been selling fruit and vegetables. She is a hard worker and is well known in her area, with a good reputation and special products and prices. Marites is applying for a loan amounting 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos)  in order to increase her merchandise with fruits and vegetables specially requested by her customers. 

She hopes to be able to reply to her customers' requests and fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy squash, beans, Chinese pechay (cabbage) and cabbage for her business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who swears never to live in poverty despite his poor background. Jackson trades in coffee and also has a retail shop where he earns a daily income. The coffee business is seasonal and requires a lot of labor input to collect from different farmers. Nevertheless, he has been able to reap tangible benefits. Jackson intends to use this loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to resell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has been operating her hog fattening business for three years now, but she is still struggling to reach her desired income. She wants to earn more than her usual profit to support her family. Right now, she is prioritizing her hog fattening business in order to make progress in her business.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of P 10,000 to buy one additional pig to raise, and feed and vitamins for the pigs. She hopes this will provide a better income to improve their current living standard.

loans.use: to buy one additional pig to raise, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village of Barumbong. For the past four years, Gloria has been raising pigs and selling groceries to support her family. She also buys and sells rice in her local area to earn more income. Gloria earns about 250 PHP each day to meet her family’s needs.

Gloria is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs. She will also use a portion of her loan to buy more rice to resell. Gloria hopes her loan will enable her to increase her income and expand her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs and rice to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella wants to develop her sari-sari (general store) business; this leads her to ask for a loan amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase biscuits, breads, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and soft drinks. She is preparing for the development of her family. She really wants to provide her family with a good living, so Estrella is working hard to make a profitable income.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, breads, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles, 49, is a humble merchant from the village of Barumbong. She lives with her partner and her three children. For four years she has been running her own grocery store, which she began with only a little capital selling snack food. She sold enough to invest, little by little, in her business, turning it into a grocery store in an effort to earn more profits. She sought out financing to buy more products in order to attend to customer demand.

Angeles is requesting a loan to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, and beans, as well as school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, etc. In an effort to expand her business and obtain more income, in the future she would like to turn her grocery store into a general store. Another goal of hers is to set up a food business.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, and beans, as well as school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, and rulers,.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia believes that "Patience and sacrifices are the keys to success."  She is 61 years old and has six adult children. They live in a rural community and work in farming and hog-raising. Due to financial constraints, Aurelia aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. 

To improve the business, Aurelia is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins needed in hog-raising. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that someday she will make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rowena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, who is 55 years old, is married and has four children. She has operated her retail store in her village for nearly 20 years. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP 7,000 to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store. 

Editha is determined to improve her business so she can supplement the needs of her family. Her profits will be used as additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, married, and has four children. With one child currently in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, vinegar, sugar, bread, etc. Erlinda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, vinegar, sugar, bread, can goods, etc. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store such as shampoo, vinegar, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old man, married with ten children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He describes himself as a hard-working man operating a produce business dealing in maize, beans and groundnuts which he has operated for a period of twenty years now. The business is rural-based and he started it to enable him get daily income for the smooth running of his family. He would like to build a permanent house for his family and educate his children up to the university. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en: Dionicia is a 58-year-old married woman. She has raised and cared for pigs for almost five years now. She has asked for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the rice field and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she hopes she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticides for the rice field and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local brew and maize to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 49 years old. She has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for more than a year. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of food for her pigs. So she is requesting a loan  of PHP 5,000 to buy  enough feed and vitamins for her pigs. This will enable her to better nourish her pigs and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy enough feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn is 40 years old and engaged in hog fattening. Because of experiencing food scarcity with her family, she has been doing this to earn income. She wants to raise more hogs to earn more income. She was grateful to know about Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. who are helping the needy like her. So Madelyn is asking for a loan amount of P 7,000 to buy three pigs to raise. She hopes this will be a stepping stone to fight poverty.

loans.use: to buy three pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for dairy and livestock business

loans.name: Michi

texts.en: Michi is 40 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Michi provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns about PHP 300 daily. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that he will use to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, a sprocket, and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Normelita

texts.en:
Normelita is a 43-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has six children. The eldest is 22 and the youngest is one year old. She has operated her 'sari-sari' or variety store business for 24 years now as well as also engaging in fishing as her second business, together with her husband. This is the source of her income covering the needs of her family.

Normelita is requesting for a loan to buy fish net, fish hooks and tie wires. These will be used in fishing. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for the productivity in her fishing business.

In the future, Normelita hopes to expand her business. And also she hopes that her children can continue their schooling.

loans.use: to buy fish net, fish hooks, and tie wires.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 58 years old and married with ten children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Eusebia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Eusebia has been buying and selling livestock for four years and also earns additional income from a beauty salon.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: María, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y como vigilante en una empresa privada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Intibucá. Hace 15 años que doña María se dedica a su propio negocio de confección y venta de delantales o gabachas de cocina para vender. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 6,500.00 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de delantales como ser la tela, hilos, encajes etc. su meta es apoyar a su familia con las ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 62 years old and married.  Her husband works in agriculture and as a watchman at a private company.  She has two children, and she lives in the Intibucá municipality.

María has had her own business of sewing and making kitchen aprons or ‘gabachas’ [traditional Guatamalen aprons] to sell.  She works by orders.

She has decided to request a second loan from ODEF for 6,500 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy raw material to make the aprons.  She will buy things like fabric, thread, and lace, etc.  Her goal is to support her family with the income.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make aprons to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 39 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a vegetable business in the local community. She has been with her business for over five years and earns PHP 3,000 every month.
