This is Roger's 1st loan through FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from a state bank previously. But FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with all facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing a crop of beans.

loans.name: Nwxsha's Group

texts.en:
Nwxsha is a 35-year-old married Iraqi mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nwxsha is one of many Iraqi women working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nwxsha has five years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. She makes dresses for women and children as well as small fabric household items. She would like to improve the services she can offer her customers and would like to purchase an over machine. She would also like to be able to work more hours and actually be in more control of planning her work time. To do so she would like to buy a small generator which will allow her to work even during the hours of the frequent, random power cuts in the city. To be able to pay for these plans, she has requested a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase an over machine and a small generator.

loans.name: Elsa Lilian

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 24 años de edad, tiene esposo y dos hijos con los cuales habita en una aldea del Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Elsa es una persona muy emprendedora lleva dedicándose a la agricultura  específicamente a la siembra de café desde hace 10 años. Empezó esta actividad con el fin de generar ingresos para poder darle a su familia el sustento necesario. El café lo vende en le mercado local  a un precio rentable.
Ella solicito su préstamo numero once de 20000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante, fungicida y mantenimiento general de la finca. Con esta inversión espera obtener mejor producción y cosechas para que sus ingresos aumenten.
Su meta es seguirle dando el mantenimiento necesario a la finca,  para tener una solvencia económica que respalde el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 24 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a neighborhood in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Elsa is an enterprising person who works as a farmer. Specifically, she has been growing coffee for the past 10 years. She started in this business so that she could generate income and provide for her family’s needs. The coffee is sold for a profit at the local market.

Elsa is requesting her eleventh loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL. The money will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers and fumigants, as well as pay for general maintenance around her farm. With this investment, she hopes to improve her crops and obtain better production so that her income will go up. Her goal is to continue maintaining her farm so that she will have the financial solvency to provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fumigants, as well as pay for general maintenance around her farm.

loans.name: Hamdia

texts.en:
Hamdia is 29 years old. She is a married Iraqi woman and mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hamdia is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Hamdia has eight years of experience with the small home-based sewing and tailoring business. She makes custom-order dresses for women and children and also makes small fabric household items based on orders. She would like to improve the variety of services she can offer and increase her creativity with the purchase of an overlock machine and some nice, good-quality fabrics and raw materials. She also has many ideas for making her work area a little nicer after she has focused on her priority purchases.

To be able to pay for the new items, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $1800. Hamdia will turn 30 later this year. Being under the age of 30, she qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase of an overlock machine and some good-quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom currently attend school. For the past five years, Mohammad has been working hard to manage his boutique, which sells men's clothing. 

To help expand his business, Mohammad  has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase different types of clothes to sell, and will help Mohammad to generate greater profits. Mohammad hopes that in the future he will be able to have a big business. 

Mohammad is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mohammad who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes to sell

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es: Avelino tiene la edad de 48 años, esta casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra semilla  e insumos y además ayudarse con la mano de obra dar para realizar una plantación de chile. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarles a sus hijos  una mejor educación y  calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Avelino is 48 years old. He is married and now lives with his wife and three children. He wants a loan to buy seeds and supplies and also to help him with labor to complete a planting of peppers. He wants to give appropriate maintenance to the crop so that this will allow him to have a better production and thus have better economic income. He hopes in the future to offer his children a better education and quality of life and a more stable economic situation, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan that he will receive from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with a better payment plan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow peppers.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
This is Joselito, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married and is a father to their children. He manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joselito operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Joselito earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 350 (Philippine Pesos) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Joselito is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Joselito dreams to expand his business and hopes to give his children a good life and education. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel  tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, y vive con la esposa y cuatro hijos . El vive en santa marta . El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas doble prosito, para cría y leche. El quiere aumentar un poco la cantidad de animales, para tener más posibilidad de vender más crías. El se ha dedicado con su familia al cultivo de granos básicos complementado con la ganadería. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Daniel is 47 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children. He lives in Santa Marta. He wants a loan to buy cattle for two purposes, to raise and for milk. He wants to increase his herd of animals a little, in order to have more possibilities of selling more young cattle. With his family he has worked in raising basic grains, complemented by livestock raising. This is the first loan that he will receive from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Walter Andres

texts.es: El joven Walter, tiene 27 años de edad es soltero sin hijos que mantener, vive en casa de sus padres, siendo el hijo único, él ha trabajado de taxista, también entregaba verduras a puestos de ventas, ahora trabaja en un mercado de Managua en un tramo de abarrotería, el tiene muchos deseos de superación en especial de mejorar la vivienda de sus padres, por eso solicita este primer credito para cambiarle el techo de la casa que esta muy oxidado y en la temporada de lluvia se pasa el agua  comprara laminas de zinc, perlines para empezar la mejora.
texts.en: Walter is a 27-year old young man, single and with no children. He is an only child and lives at his parents' house. After working as a taxi driver and as a vegetables deliveryman, he now works in a grocery store at a market in Managua. He has a strong desire of self-improvement, specially of making improvements at his parents' house. This is why he's requesting this first loan that he'll use to change the ceiling, which is very rusty and filters water during the rainy season. As a first step, he will buy zinc and steel layers.

loans.use: to buy zinc and steel.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya.  She is a married mother of three school-going children.  She runs a clothing shop which has been operating for two years.  Mourine was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit.  She is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase new clothes for sale.

Mourine believes the income from this loan will help to educate her children.  She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the high supplier costs, which makes most of her items beyond reach of the public.

loans.use: to purchase items for her shop (eg.  curtains, dresses, trousers, shirts).

loans.name: Aracelly

texts.es: Aracelly tiene la edad de 34 años, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Aracelly se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Aracelly is a 34-year old woman who is married and has a son. She's requesting a loan to buy livestock that she'll breed, sell when it grows and make a profit from. The livestock business will help her and her family to get ahead. This is Aracelly's first loan with FUDECOSUR and she says the credit committee has helped her a lot and given her good conditions. She expects this business to help her grow and reach her goals, so that she'll be able to provide her family with a better qualify of life and financial stability in the future. She hasn't received loans from national banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered its support with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old, mixed crop farmer. She is a married mother of two children. She has been doing the farming business for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Elizabeth is applying for her second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase farm inputs and animal feed. 

She will use the anticipated profits to venture into a bee-keeping business. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animal feed.

loans.name: Wastaarabu Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is in her 30’s.  She is married and the mother of two boys who are in school.  For a period of three years now, Hidaya has been managing her family by running two business activities, selling charcoal and managing a restaurant offering different food services like breakfast and lunch.  She is doing fine.  She starts her activities at 6 AM and completes them at 7 PM daily.  She is capable of generating a better profit each month.

This request is Hidaya's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She has repaid all previous loans successfully.  She used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and more food items.  With the extra profit she received, she bought a plot of land where she expects to build a house in the future.  She also purchased a TV, a refrigerator and a cupboard and paid both school fees for her boys and home expenses.  She will use this loan to buy and stock more charcoal, to purchase food items and to renovate her restaurant premise.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a nice house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "WASTAARABU," which has a total of 13 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy and stock more charcoal, to purchase food items and to reinovate her restaurant premise.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 56 años de edad, es un campesino dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 31 años, actividad que le ha permitido ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. En la actualidad se desempeña como mayordomo en una finca ubicada en el municipio de Sonsón, Colombia, en donde cultiva papa criolla y arveja, gracias a que el propietario le prestó un lote de la finca. Debido a la amplitud de las  hectáreas, Francisco desea comprar una novillona la cual le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos para realizar la inversión.  

Francisco espera poder capitalizar su inversión para incrementar el ganado con el fin de tener una gran empresa lechera y poder independizarse en un futuro.
texts.en: Francisco is a 56-year old farmer, who has been working in agriculture for the past 31 years. This activity has made it possible for him to provide his family with better life conditions. He now works as a butler in a ranch located in Sonsón, Colombia, where he cultivates creole potatoes and peas in the plot that he borrowed from the owner. Given that the plot is very spacious, Francisco wants to buy a young cow that will give him additional income for his family's well-being. He doesn't have the resources to make the investment, which is why he's requesting a loan. Francisco expects to capitalize on the investment and increase the livestock, with an aim to have a large dairy business and be able to become independent in the future.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Luisa Antonia

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus hijos y nietos, lamentablemente Luisa es viuda, desde entonces ella ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Luisa pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería, pero después de la pérdida de su esposo dejó de ejercer su carrera.
Actualmente Luisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida y adicionalmente vende productos de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luisa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción de su carrito sanguchero, ya que en las noches desea vender hamburguesas, salchipapas, pollo broaster y otros, así pues Luisa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 40 year old woman and lives in the city of Ica with her children and grandchildren. Sadly Luisa is a widow. Since she became a widow she has put all her efforts into ensuring her family get ahead. Thanks to her own efforts, Luisa was able to study nursing. However, after losing her husband she stopped working in this area.

At the moment Luisa works in her small business, which is selling food. She also sells beauty products. She works every day for approximately 12 hours and believes that it is going well for her because she is a talented cook and because she is nice to her customers.

Luisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as it is thanks to their help that she can replace her “carrito sanguchero” (a mobile kitchen-cart for preparing fried food), as she would like to sell hamburgers, “salchipapas” (a dish of sausages and fried potatoes), rotisserie chicken etc. at night time. Then Luisa can continue to work and try to realise her dream of having a big restaurant.

loans.use: to replace her "carrito sanguchero" (a mobile kitchen-cart for preparing fried food)

loans.name: Tiro Group

texts.en:
Malizia, who is in her early 30’s, is married and lives with her husband.  She is the mother of three children (two boys and a girl) who are in school. For a period of three years now, she has operated two businesses, selling food and charcoal.  She is doing fine with her businesses and her family as well.  She works from 6 AM to 8 PM daily and is able to generate a fair profit each month.

This is Malizia's fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She repaid her previous loans successfully and used them to restock items in both her food and charcoal businesses.  With the profit she earned, she bought a cupboard, covered home expenses and paid school fees.  She will use this loan to increase her stock of sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to one day be able to build a nice family house and provide her children with a better education. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TIRO," which has a total of 10 members.  The members of TIRO will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Elkin Humberto

texts.es:
Élkin es un campesino de 35 años de edad dedicado a las labores agrícolas, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar. 
La razón más importante para salir adelante son sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, a los que sueña poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
En la actualidad tiene cultivos de tomate de árbol, fríjol y arveja, productos que comercializa en la plaza de mercado de su municipio.
Élkin es un hombre con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y está seguro que la única forma de lograrlo es trabajar fuertemente, por lo cual labora diariamente de cinco de la mañana a seis de la tarde.
Su mayor sueño es ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, sin ninguna carencia económica.
Con la esperanza de mejorar su producción, Élkin se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes agrícolas, que le permitirán aumentar sus ingresos y garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elkin is a 35-year-old farmer who works in farm labouring, work he learned by family tradition. The most important reason to move forward is his four dependent sons; he dreams of being able to offer them a better quality of life. 

Currently he has tamarillo, bean and pea crops, products that he sells in the marketplace in his municipality. Elkin is a man with a great desire for success and he is sure that the only way to achieve it is to work hard. For this reason he works from five o'clock in the morning to six o'clock in the evening everyday. His greatest dream is to offer his family a better quality of life without financial lack. 

With the hope of improving his production, Elkin is applying for a loan to use to buy seeds and farming fertilizers that will allow him to increase his income and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming fertilizer.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Raising hogs for future sale is the business of Monica where she gains about PHP 5,000 for each hog disposal. Monica is 55 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are employed locally. Her spouse is a farmer and, together, they generate income for the family. 

Monica is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hog sustenance. With the help of this loan, Monica will ensure good growth of the hogs. Though she only generates minimal income from selling hogs, Monica hopes to keep improving her business for income stability.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hog sustenance.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis  tiene  59  años de edad, esta casado  y vive con la  esposa y tres hijos actualmente. El con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. El piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Luis is 59 years old and married.  He currently lives with his wife and their three children.  When this loan, he intends to purchase supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides, as well as help with the manual labor.  He wants to provide maintenance to his crops so that they will not suffer damage or lose production, generating more revenue from his coffee project to contribute to his family.  At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds for these purchases or contracts, since he is of low income and he does not have the means to acquire the money needed for this.  Therefore, he is requesting this loan which is his first from FUDECOSUR.  Prior to this loan, he has never had any loans from national banks, however FUDECOSUR has granted him this loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta tiene la edad de 59 años, es casada y tiene  con los dos hijos y el esposo. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría para aumentar el numero de ganado y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito  le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marta, 59, is married and has two children with her husband.  She wants the loan to buy livestock to raise to expand the number of animals.  She'll sell them when they're big and earn a profit.  The livestock business will help her get ahead with her family.

This is her first financing from FUDECOSUR.  She says the credit committee has made it easy for her.

She hopes she grows with this project and achieves her objectives so in the future she can give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans previously from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: This time, Lolita is borrowing 15,000 PHP in order to buy more fish to sell in the community.  Her business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA and it continues to provide Lolita and her family with an income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is still doing her farming business. She is grateful to KADET LTD and KIVA for the financial help she got. She is still repaying her previous loan. She is applying for her second loan to purchase fertilizers for use on the farm .She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. She hopes to have a bumper harvest this season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Isidore

texts.en: Isidore is a 40-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Isidore started selling lights in August 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Niringiyimana Laurence, and their five children.

loans.use: To buy10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Deborah, a 35-year-old single mother of three children aged 3, 7 and 15, all in school, rents a shop in Kampala where she sells traditional wear for women known locally as "gomesi." She started this business after her husband abandoned her; as a mother, Deborah refused to sacrifice her children’s future, one that would be grim without education and all their basic needs being met. She therefore saved some money from the sale of charcoal, which enabled her to start a business selling traditional clothing in town, and this has enabled her to meet the growing needs of her family.

Deborah has dreams of expanding her business and educating her children up to higher levels of learning so that they have a bright future. With no support from the children's father, however, this is difficult. Limited capital has led to slow business growth, and she hopes the loan will help her boost the enterprise through the purchase of new stock which will attract more customers.

When approached, Deborah’s neighbors and workmates described her as a courageous, hardworking and co-operative lady.

loans.use: to buy traditional women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mzeo

texts.en:
Mzeo is 32 years old. She lives in a small village in Tetritskaro District with her parents, sister and brother-in-law. Mzeo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Her father works at a cleaning service and gets a monthly income. Her brother-in-law has a tractor and serves local people to earn income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Mzeo requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Mzeo will begin trading clothing and bed clothing. She plans to purchase clothing and bed clothing from wholesalers and then re-sell with a price markup among her villagers. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading clothing and bed clothing

loans.name: Jairo De Jesús

texts.es:
Jairo a sus 47 años de edad, se proyecta con  un microempresario. Desde hace doce años decidió montar su propio negocio dedicado  a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, en el cual labora en conjunto con su esposa.
Gracias a su trabajo ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar y garantizarles a sus dos hijos menores de edad acceso a la educación.
Su mayor sueño es poder ofrecerle a su familia una vivienda propia. 
Asegura que su hogar es su gran aliciente y la mayor fuente de energía que lo impulsa a seguir adelante cada día. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para incrementar el volumen de ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
47-year-old Jairo is a micro entrepreneur.  Twelve years ago he decided to set up his own business selling basic household groceries.  He works in his business together with his wife.

Thanks to their work, Jairo has been able to improve his household's living conditions and guarantee his two dependent children access to an education.  His biggest dream is to be able to offer his family a home of their own.  He says that his family is his biggest incentive and they give him the energy he needs to continue making progress every day.

Jairo is currently requesting a loan to invest in buying stock so that he can increase his sales volume and make more income.

loans.use: to buy basic household groceries

loans.name: Jefferson Alexander

texts.es:
Jefferson de 26 años de edad, es un emprendedor que busca oportunidades para sacar adelante su familia. Uno de sus mayores sueños ha sido montar su negocio ya que por condiciones de salud, le es muy difícil emplearse. 
Gracias a la sugerencia de un pariente que lo motivó para montar una sala de videojuegos e internet, Jefferson hoy ve cumplido su sueño. Aunque no contaba con los recursos para invertir en capital, esto no fue un obstáculo, solicitó un crédito y dio inicio a su proyecto, en el cual ha trabajado durante cinco años.
Una de las mayores ventajas que Jefferson encuentra de su trabajo es la ubicación del local, debido a la cercanía con instituciones educativas, lo que se traduce en un mayor número de ingresos. Actualmente su esposa le colabora en el negocio en horas de la tarde, ya que el horario de atención es de ocho de la mañana a nueve de la noche.
Con el propósito de ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, Jefferson se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de dos computadores y una nevera pequeña  a fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio.
texts.en:
26-year-old Jefferson is an entrepreneur who is always looking for opportunities to get his family ahead in life.  One of his biggest dreams was to set up his own business because it is very difficult for him to find a job as a result of some health problems he has.

One of Jefferson's relatives encouraged him to set up a video game and Internet business and, by doing so, he has achieved his dream.  Although he didn't have the capital he needed to invest, he did not let this hold him back.  He requested a loan and started his business.  He has been working in his business for five years now.

One of the main advantages that Jefferson's business has is its location as it is near a number of educational institutions which means he earns more income.  His wife is currently helping out with the business during the afternoons as he serves his customers from 8.00am to 9.00pm.

With the aim of expanding his business and improving his family's living conditions, Jefferson is requesting a loan to invest in buying two computers and a small fridge.  This will enable him to improve the quality of the service he offers.

loans.use: to buy two computers and a small freezer

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
John Fredy de 31 años de edad, se ha dedicado a las labores del campo desde su niñez. Gracias a su padre aprendió de la agricultura y la ganadería,
En la actualidad se dedica a la lechería, actividad que se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos para su familia, integrada por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. 
Su mayor anhelo es poder garantizarle  a su familia una vivienda digna y una mejor calidad de vida. Con el propósito de alcanzar su sueño, Fredy desea aumentar su producción de leche, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca, de este modo espera mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecerle a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old John Fredy has worked in the fields since he was a child.  He learned farming and ranching thanks to his father.  Currently, he works in dairy farming, which has become the source of income for his family, which is made up of his wife and two young children.

His greatest wish is to be able to secure a decent home and a better quality of life for his family.  In order to achieve his dream, Fredy wants to increase his production of milk, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy a cow.  He expects this to increase his profits so he can offer his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 35-year-old married man with six children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old.  Five of the children attend school.  Tadeo has been selling plantains since 2009.  Plantains are a Ugandan delicacy, known locally as 'matooke’.  In addition, he does farming to supplement his income. 

He started his business in the outskirts of Kyotera, where he lives, but he buys the matooke from the neighboring villages.  He would like the loan to buy more matooke, which is in high demand in the city.  Once purchased, he loads it on trucks and transports it to the city where he sells it at a higher price.  He dreams of having enough capital to buy matooke in bulk so he can fill an entire truck by himself and, therefore, save on transportation costs.  According to interactions with colleagues, Tadeo is a very hardworking person.  In the photo is Tadeo with the green plantains.

loans.use: to buy plantains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 48-year-old, Iraqi woman. She is a widow and, since the death of her husband, she took care of their four children alone. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwin is one of the many Iraqi women working from home. She uses her sewing skills to generate the income and meet the financial needs of her children she is solely responsible for.

Parwin has 18 years in the sewing and tailoring business and has managed to establish a nice reputation among her customers. She makes dresses for women and children and also fabric, household items based on orders. 

She would like to give even more to her customers, offering them a greater variety of creative services and nice quality works. She would like to purchase an over machine and an embroidery machine. To be able to pay for these items, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase an over machine and an embroidery machine for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña María, en compañía de su esposo continúan con su pequeña pulpería, en su trayecto ha trabajado bastante como hacer muchas costuras para mantener a sus hijos, los cuales son muchos y ahora independientes, ella solicita el credito para invertir en su oficio principal, comprando materia prima como telas variadas y accesorios para poder cumplir con varios pedidos de costuras y comprar productos de cosméticos, esto para no dejar de trabajar ya que ella toma como terapia para no enfermarse, el trabajo.
texts.en:
María and her husband continue with their small grocery store.  She has worked a lot in her life, doing a lot of sewing to support her many children, who are now independent.

She's requesting the loan to invest in her main profession, buying raw materials (such as a variety of fabric and accessories to be able to fill several sewing orders) and cosmetics products.

This way she won't stop working, because she considers her job a form of therapy to keep from getting sick.

loans.use: to buy fabric, accessories, and cosmetics

loans.name: Gilma Rosa

texts.es:
Gilma de 61 años de edad, ha dedicado su vida a laborar para ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor condición de vida y garantizarle el acceso a la educación. 
Tras el abandono de su esposo, esta mujer se hizo cargo de todas las responsabilidades del hogar, por lo cual se dedicó a la venta de fritos en las afueras de su residencia.
Por su falta de oportunidades, debe rebuscarse día a día el sustento para su hogar, ya que su falta de educación le cerró las puertas para acceder al mundo laboral. Con su valentía y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 

Todos los días comienza su faena a las cuatro de la mañana, en el lugar de su trabajo, comercializando fritos y café, posteriormente se dirige a su casa a realizar las labores domésticas y a preparar los productos que venderá el día siguiente.
Su mayor sueño es poder adecuar su negocio en un local y comprar más surtido para incrementar las ventas, razón por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito debido a que no cuenta con capital propio para la compra de materia prima e insumos(carnes frías y café).
texts.en:
61-year-old Gilma has dedicated her life to work in order to offer her son a better quality of life and ensure access to education for him. 

After being abandoned by her husband, this woman took on all the responsibilities of the home. For this reason she worked selling fried foods outside her home. Because of the lack of opportunities, day by day she has to search hard for a living for her family, because her lack of education closed the doors to access to the world of work. With courage and effort she has managed to move her family forward. 

Everyday she begins working at 4 o'clock in the morning in her workplace, selling fried foods and coffee. After that she goes home to do the housework and prepare the products that she will sell the next day.

Her greatest dream is to be able to find a premises for her business and buy a greater selection [of products] to increase sales. For this reason she is applying for a loan because she hasn't got any capital of her own to rely on to buy the raw materials and supplies (cold meats and coffee.)

loans.use: to buy cold meats and coffee.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es:
Katerine de 26 años, es reconocida en su municipio por ser una mujer esforzada, y llena de ganas por salir adelante. En su vida le ha tocado afrontar situaciones que le han permitido valorar la vida y amar su trabajo. 
Desde hace tres años se dedica a la elaboración de panelitas, las cuales vende puerta a puerta en su municipio. Gracias a esta actividad, logra sostener a su madre quien se encuentra en delicado estado de salud y a su hijo de dos años de edad. 
Su mayor dificultad, ha sido hacerse cargo de todas las responsabilidades del hogar, ya que sus ingresos, no son suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas. Sin embargo agradece a Dios, por que cuenta con una bella familia que la apoya y le brinda la fortaleza para seguir adelante.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de tres vitrinas e insumos para incrementar la producción y mejorar la condición económica de de su casa. 
Su mayor sueño es poder reunir el dinero suficiente para comprar una vivienda que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
26-year-old Katerine is well known in her town as a hard-working woman who has a great desire to get ahead.  She has faced situations in life which have taught her to value life and love her work.  

For three years now, Katerine has been making fudge which she sells door to door in her town.  Thanks to this business she manages to support her mother, who is in poor health, and her 2-year-old son.

Katerine's main difficulty has been taking care of her household responsibilities as her income isn't enough to cover their basic needs.  However, she thanks God because she has a beautiful family who support her and give her the strength to keep moving forward.

Katerine is currently requesting a loan to buy three display cases and supplies so that she can increase her production of fudge and improve her family's financial situation.

Katerine's biggest dream is to get together enough money to buy a house so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three display cases and supplies for making fudge

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 33 years old. He lives in Ozurgeti District with retired parents. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

George opened a grocery shop recently where he sells different kinds of groceries. The only income of the family is the monthly pension of George’s parents and a small profit from the shop.  According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

George requested a loan for purchasing more stock of groceries, which will help his newly started business to develop. He will reinvest the profit in the same business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family and George will be able to better look after his aged parents.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries for his newly opened shop

loans.name: Ligia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ligia de 63 años de edad, asegura que su mayor motivación para levantarse cada día y darlo todo en su trabajo son sus hijos y nietos. Desde hace 40 años se dedica a las labores agrícolas. 
Después del fallecimiento de su esposo, esta mujer se hizo cargo de las obligaciones del hogar, por lo cual siguió con el negocio familiar dedicado a la producción y comercialización de leche.
Hoy agradece a Dios por su trabajo, porque gracias a este logró sacar sus tres hijos adelante, garantizándoles una buena educación.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinara en la adecuación de una pieza para tanque de frío, en donde debe almacenar la leche. Con esta inversión espera que mejorar sus ingresos, ya que por falta del cuarto su producto de descompone demasiado rápido lo que le ocasiona cuantiosas pérdidas. 
Su mayor sueño es poder hacer de su negocio una gran empresa y generar los ingresos suficientes para tener una vejez de calidad.
texts.en:
Ligia, 63, says that her children and grandchildren are her main motivation to get up every day and give her all to her work.  She has been a farmer for 40 years.

After the death of her husband she took charge of the household, continuing with the family's milk production and sales business.  

Now she thanks God for her work, because it has allowed her to provide for her 3 children and give them a good education. 

At this time, Ligia is requesting a loan to modify a part of her cooling tank where she stores her milk.  With this investment, she hopes to increase her income, because due to the lack of space her milk goes bad too quickly, which at times has caused her considerable losses.

Ligia's dreams are to build her business into a large company, and to generate enough income so that she can have a quality life when she is older.

loans.use: to upgrade a cooling tank

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva está casada y vive en casa propia en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene por actividad la elaboración de dulces de sahumerio (sahumerio es un ritual antiguo que se usa para dar gracias a la madre tierra), esta actividad la realiza desde muy joven; también tiene un microbús y con ambas actividades ella genera sus ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia. 

Solicita el crédito para aumentar su capital, comprar más ingredientes  y poder elaborar en mayor cantidad de dulces de sahumerio y poder alcanzar a vender en el exterior.

El sueño de Eva fue tener su propia casa lo cual ya logro, ahora su sueño es que sus tres hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eva is married and she lives in her own home in the San Martin neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  She makes sahumerio, or incense, candy (sahumerio is an ancient ritual that is used to give thanks to Mother Earth).  She has done this work since she was very young.  She also has a minibus and between these two businesses she makes enough income to support her family.  

She is asking for this loan to increase her capital, buy more ingredients, be able to make her incense candy in greater quantities, and be able to sell abroad.

Eva's dream was to have her own home and she achieved it.  Currently, her dream is for her three children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to keep making incense candy

loans.name: Monica Marizela

texts.es: La Sra. Monica sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y  venta de pan conversando con ella nos conto  que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad y ahora incremento su producción, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina, manteca y demás insumos para la elaboración de pan ya que en este último tiempo incremento su clientela.
texts.en: Monica continues working in the same business: making and selling bread.  Speaking with her, she told us that her previous loan was very helpful as she used it to buy a larger-capacity stove and thereby increased her production.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy flour, butter and other supplies for making bread as her number of customers has increased recently.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam está casada y tiene dos hijos; vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, su actividad es la elaboración de maní confitado el cual elabora y vende en el centro de la ciudad. 

Miriam solicita el crédito para compra de insumos (mani.azucar), ya que a la fecha encontró otra forma de vender el maní (Molido, Tostado, Confitado, Etc.), de esta manera tratará de mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Miriam es poder tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en alquiler

Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Miriam is married and has two children.  She lives in the Pasankeri neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  She makes candied peanuts for a living, which she sells in the city's center.

Miriam is asking for a loan to buy ingredients (peanuts, sugar), as she has found other ways to sell peanuts (ground, toasted, candied, etc.) and she wants to try to increase her profits.

Miriam's dream is to have her own home as she currently rents.

This is the fourth time her loan has been channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar to make candied, toasted, and ground peanuts and to improve her sales.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 34 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a dress shop in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 4 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 15,500 PHP to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Subira, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children; one of them goes to school and the other one is still small.  She has been running two businesses, selling charcoal and a stationary shop. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Subira's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open a stationary shop and increase on the charcoal stock, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and restock the missing items in the stationary shop.  She used the interest to buy iron sheets, paid school fees and covered household expenses.  She dreams of building her own house as she has already bought a plot of land.

Subira will share this loan with her loan group "RUFIJI", with 27 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and restock the missing items in the stationary shop

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en la zona de Chacaltaya de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto para transporte de pasajeros con el cual genera sus ingresos de forma diaria y puede mantener a su familia, 

Leonardo solicita el crédito para compra de motor y poner en buen estado de funcionamiento su vehículo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.

El sueño de Leonardo es tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Leonarda is married with two children and he lives in the Chacaltaya neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He has a passenger car he uses to generate his daily income to support his family.

Leonardo is asking for this loan to buy a motor and get his car into good working condition, as it is his only source of income to support his family.

Leonardo's dream is to have his own home as he currently lives in his parents' home.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his taxi and keep working to support his family

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es:
Jeanette está soltera vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene  dos hijos a los cuales mantiene ella sola; su actividad es generar ingresos a través de dos automóviles que hace trabajar en transporte público donde percibe una renta diaria.

Jeanette solicita el crédito para compra de repuestos y de esta manera poner estable uno de sus vehículos ya que es su herramienta de trabajo que le permite generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva. Su historial de pagos es impecable.
texts.en:
Jeanette is single and lives at home with her parents in the San Martin neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  She has two children whom she supports on her own.  She earns a living with two cars she rents daily for public transportation.

Jeanette is asking for a loan to buy parts so she will be able to repair on of her cars, as they are the tools that allow her to have an income and support her family.

This is the fifth time she is asking for a loan through Kiva.  Her payment record is impeccable.

loans.use: to buy parts for one of her passenger vehicles

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es: El Sr. Casimiro  tiene 51 años, casado con dos hijos que tienen las edades de 17 y 16 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Huayrocondo, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Casimiro  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Casimiro  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Casimiro is 51 years old.  He is married with two children who are 17 and 16.  He makes and sells cheese and milk for a living as he raises cattle.  He lives in the locality of Huayrocondo.  The people there work in farming and ranching.  This loan is his first cycle with this institution.  Casimiro will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.  He is asking for this loan because he does not have the money for the purchase and it will help him enormously, as it will provide a good amount of milk.  This will allow him to make more cheeses and milk and to improve his income.  Casimiro faces challenges in his business such as having to buy fodder every so often, and he will use his profits to improve his livestock.  His wish is to make cheeses in bulk and sell them to different markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura de 43 años de edad, esta casada con Agustín de 49 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos. Esta familia cuenta con una casa propia.Maura se dedica a la agricultura razón y siembra verduras como ruda, orégano y manzanilla, plantas que no necesitan de mucha asistencia, inversión y tiempo.
“El negocio es constante cada vez que mis plantaciones están grandes, las corto, las amarro en pequeños paquetes y las vendo a 0.50 céntimos cada uno”, explica. Además detalla que sembrar este tipo de vegetales es más sencillo por que crecen, se cortan, vuelven a crecer y se siguen cortando, evitándose gastar en abono, fertilizantes, mano de obra entre otras cosas, situaciones que años anteriores fueron una preocupación persistente. Por otra parte, los ingresos que obtiene le son rentables por que ya cuenta con clientes en la ciudad de Lima , en donde vende 3 paquetes de ruda o manzanilla a 2 soles, el doble de precio que en la ciudad de Tarma. Maura accederá a su segundo préstamo con KIVA, entidad a la que agradece por confiar en ella y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos.Con los S/1000 soles , Maura comprará sacos de abono orgánico de 118 soles cada uno para esparcirlos en sus terrenos de espinacas, arvejas, y orégano; cultivos para la siguiente temporada.
texts.en:
Maura, who is 43, is married to Agustín, who is 49.  They have four children.  This family has its own home.  Maura farms for a living, growing vegetables such as rue, oregano, and chamomile, which are plants that do not need much tending, investment, or time.  

She says that her business is constant, as every time her crops get big, she cuts them, ties them in small bundles, and sells them for 50 cents each.  She also tells us that growing this kind of plant is simpler because when they grow, you can cut them and they grown back, so you do not have to spend money on fertilizers and labor, among other things that were a constant concern for her in years past.  Furthermore, the profits she makes are worthwhile because she has reliable customers in the city of Lima, where she sells three bundles of rue or chamomile for 2 soles, which is double the price in Tarma.  This will be Maura's second loan with Kiva, whom she thanks for placing its trust in her.  She promises to make her payments on time.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, Maura will buy sacks of organic fertilizer for 118 soles each to spread on her spinach, pea, and oregano crops, which are for the coming season.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar está separado de la esposa vive solo en la zona de santa Rosa de la ciudad de la Paz; tiene tres hijos, genera sus ingresos a través de un automóvil que tiene el cual lo trabaja en transporte público; con esta actividad  genera sus ingresos y se mantiene.

Edgar solicita el crédito para compra de motor y de esta manera mantener estable su vehículo ya que es su única herramienta de trabajo con la cual genera sus ingresos.

El sueño de Edgar comprarse su propia casa.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Edgar is separated from his wife and lives alone in Santa Rosa district, in the city of La Paz.  He has three children and makes his income with a car that he owns and uses to provide a public transport service.  Through this business, he makes income and supports himself.

Edgar is requesting this loan to buy an engine so that he can keep his vehicle running as it is the only work tool he has for making income.

Edgar's dream is to buy his own house.  This is the fourth time he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his taxi so that he can continue making income and supporting himself

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela de 27 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años, vive en la casa sus padres y se dedica a la agricultura ,es por eso que tiene que atender a sus cultivos de arvejas, habas, maíz, y otros.“El trabajo en el  campo es cansado pero cuando vendo veo que vale la pena tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. En sus 5 años como agricultora aprendió de las peripecias que el clima puede causarle , por esta razón ahora sale muy temprano de su hogar para llevar agua hacia sus cultivos mediante canales de agua que ella misma abre con las herramientas del campo.Ahora piensa en sembrar arvejas y habas, porque se acerca la temporada fuerte, donde los precios serán buenos. Tiene planeado alquilar un terreno y asi sembrar en mayor cantidad.Éste es el segundo crédito con MFP, por eso se siente comprometida en pagar puntualmente las cuotas. en esta oportunidad solicita S/. 500 soles para la compra de  semillas de arvejas, ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de este producto.
texts.en:
27-year-old Gisela is married and has a five-year-old son.  She lives in her parents' home and works as a farmer.  She tends to her pea seeds, bean seeds, corn seeds and others.  "Farm work is tiring but when I sell my produce I see that all the work has been worthwhile", she says.  During her five years working as a farmer, Gisela has learned all about the unforeseen events that the weather can bring with it.  For this reason, she leaves her home very early every morning to guide water towards her crops through water channels that she makes herself with her farm tools.  Right now, she is planning to sow pea and beans seeds because the peak season is approaching and prices will be good.  She plans to rent a plot of land so that she can grow in larger quantities.

This is Gisela's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  On this occasion, she is requesting 500 soles to buy pea seeds as she doesn't have enough money to buy them on her own.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo está casado, tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya son independientes y la última (una mujercita) vive con él  y su esposa en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto con el cual trabaja en transporte libre de pasajeros, con los ingresos del auto  mantiene a su familia. 

Ricardo solicita el crédito para compra de motor para su vehículo, ya que el que está instalado actualmente ya no funciona correctamente y no hay forma de arreglarlo, para poder ponerlo en buenas condiciones y de esta manera no dejar sin sustento a su familia.

El sueño de Ricardo fue poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos lo cual ya se realizó en las dos hijos mayores, solo le falta con la hija menor, con lo cual su sueño estaría cumplido.
texts.en:
Ricardo is married with three children, two of whom are on their own already with the last one (a young lady) living with him and his wife in the San Martin neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He has a car he uses to transport passengers and he uses his income from the car to support his family.

Ricardo is asking for a loan to buy an engine for his car, as the one that is currently installed no longer works correctly and there is no way to fix it so it can be in good condition and not leave his family with no means of support.

Ricardo's dream was to make professionals out of his children, which he did with his two eldest.  Now only his youngest daughter is left and with her, his dream would be achieved.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his taxi

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad está casada y tiene dos hijos; vive en la zona de San pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un auto (taxi) con el cual genera sus ingresos de forma diaria y puede mantener a su familia, 

Natividad solicita el crédito para compra de una radio de comunicación ya que su auto pertenece a un grupo de radio taxis y sin la radio no puede trabajar con normalidad.

El sueño de Natividad es tener su casa propia ya que actualmente vive en anticretico (anticrético es una forma legal de acuerdo entre el dueño de casa y el posible inquilino, por el cual se acuerda que el inquilino vivirá en la casa o habitación(es) por un tiempo no mayor a dos años por un monto total de dinero, al cabo de los cuales el dinero deberá ser devuelto al inquilino), de manera que está ahorrando el pago mensual).
texts.en:
Natividad is married and has two children. She lives in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. She has a taxi cab which she uses to make a daily living and support her family. 

Natividad is requesting a loan to purchase a radio communication system, since her cab belongs to a group of radio taxis and she can't work under normal conditions without a radio. 

Natividad's dream is to own her own house, since she currently has an antichresis lease. (Antichresis is a legal agreement between the property owner and the potential tenant, whereby the tenant lives in the home or room(s) for up to two years in exange for a lump sum which is returned at the end of the lease). This way she doesn't have to pay monthly.

loans.use: to buy a communication radio system so that she can work better with the radio taxi group she belongs to.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.ru: Зое 54 года у них с мужем 2 детей школьного возраста. В 2005 году они с мужем начали свой бизнес с 70,000 KGS. На сегодня в хозяйстве Зои содержится 13 голов овец и 4 теленка. Откорм и перепродажа скота приносит  10,000 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зоя обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) для покупку мелкого рогатого скота, 25 овец. Доходы от кредита Зоя планирует вложить на ремонт дома и будущем мечтает купить квартиру.
texts.en: Zoya is 54 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  In 2005, she and her husband started their own business with 70,000 KGS.  Now, under her care, she has 13 head of sheep and 4 calves.  Fattening and selling cattle brings in 10,000 KGS a month for the family.  In order to further expand her business, Zoya has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy cattle and 25 sheep.  With the income from the loan, Zoya plans to make repairs to her home.  In the future, she dreams of buying an apartment.

loans.use: To purchase 25 sheep

loans.name: Cintya

texts.es:
Cintya está soltera y tiene un hijo; vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Chamoco Chico de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene por actividad la venta de productos La Francesa como distribuidora con lo cual genera sus ingresos para mantener a su familia (La Francesa es una fábrica de panes, galletas, panetones). Ella tiene una tienda de barrio.

Solicita el crédito para aumentar su capital y poder adquirir más productos La Francesa y así mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Cintya es hacer crecer su propio negocio y convertirse en mayorista de los productos La Francesa.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Cintya is single and has a son.  She lives at home with her parents in the Chamoco Chico neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  She sells La Francesa-brand products for a living as a distributor, which is how she earns money to support her family (La Francesa makes breads, cookies, and panettoni).  She has a corner store.

She is asking for a loan to increase her capital and get more La Francesa products so she can improve her income.

Cintya's dream is to grow her own business and become a wholesaler of La Francesa products.

This is the fourth time she is applying for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more La Francesa products for her grocery store

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru: Гулмурод житель района Джиликуль. Ему 47 лет. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе. У Гулмурода тоже высшее педагогическое образование и он в течение 18 лет работал учителем в средней школе. Однако уже последние 8 лет Гулмурод занимается земледелием и выращивает пшеницу. Так как сейчас сезон посева, Гулмурод уже посеял пшеницу и теперь для обработки земли ему необходимы минеральные удобрения. С этой целью он обратился в организацию за кредитом. Гулмурод просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Он надеется получить богатый урожай пшеницы и тем самым улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en: Gulmurod lives in the Jilikul region of Tajikstan.  He's 47 years old, married and the father of two children.  His wife works as a teacher at a middle school.  Gulmurod also has a teaching degree and worked as a teacher for 18 years.  However, for the past 8 years, he has been a farmer, growing wheat.  It is planting season.  With his fields already seeded, he now needs fertilizer.  This is why he's taking out a loan. He hopes to have a bountiful wheat harvest so he can improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 39 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Romulo y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en una casa alquilada desde hace 5 años. Durante las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra diversos productos como: maíz, papa, entre otros. Comenta que sus terrenos se ubican a horas de caminata por lo que trabaja alternadamente con su esposo para no descuidar a sus hijos. “En la zona alta crío mis vacas y siembro mis productos, pero dentro de poco comenzará la cosecha por lo que necesito capital de trabajo para ello”, afirma. Tambien planea aumentar su ganado, que consta de gallinas de chacra y vacas, las cuales engorda durante algunos meses y los vende duplicando el precio. Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe , por ellos promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas . Cirila, invertirá los S/ 1000 soles en la compra de  animales como gallinas y  una vaca, para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en: Thirty-nine-year-old Cirila is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband Romulo and their three children, whom she cares for in the house they have rented for five years.  In the morning she goes to her farming plots where she grows different produce, such as corn and potatoes, among others.  She tells us that her plots are several hours away walking, so she and her husband work in shifts so as not to leave their children unattended.  She says that she raises her cows and plants her crops in the higher region, but that soon she will start to harvest, so she needs working capital.  She also plans to increase her livestock, which consists of chickens and cows, which she fattens over a period of a few months and then sells for twice the price.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial help she is receiving.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Cirila will use the 1,000 soles to buy animals, such as chickens and a cow, to increase her livestock.

loans.use: to buy chickens and a cow

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, who is married and works hard to support her family, has a tobacco retail business in the Philippines. Natividad is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of tobacco to sell.

Natividad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can rent a space at a public market.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Eloisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Eloisa, a 36-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is still single and she lives with her parents. She helps them in managing their household and their finances. She works hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ma. Eloisa is in a networking business. Her product is Green Barley, which is from the company called Health Wealth. This has been her business for three years now. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of Green Barley. 
Ma. Eloisa hopes to widen her outreach and expand her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of Green Barley needed for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
Sandra Isabel de 45 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos. Originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, Sandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer, trabajadora, responsable; la cual ha tenido que trabajar desde muy temprana edad por falta de recursos económicos ; Por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su espíritu de superación y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos,(arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, cereales jabón, detergente, cloro) desde hace 8 anos. La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unas 10 horas diarias en un lugar específico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito en invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de granos básicos para que en un futuro no muy lejano poder obtener mejores ingresos. Sandra agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sandra Isabel, 45 years old, is a single mother of four children.  She is a native of Malpaisillo, which is located in the western part of the country. Sandra is known as being a hardworking, responsible woman, who has had to work since she was very young due to the lack of financial resources. Consequently, she fights every day to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her desire to improve and get ahead she has had a business selling basic grains (rice, beans), sugar, cooking oil, cereals, soap, detergent and chlorine bleach for eight years. Her work routine spans some 10 hours a day at a specific place in the community.

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing basic gains so that, in the not too distant future, she will be able to earn a better income. Sandra is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with scarce resources and to poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they will have a way to obtain  decent work.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, such as rice and beans, sugar, cooking oil, cereals, soap, detergent, chlorine detergent.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 27 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is Married  and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past year and a half, James has been working hard to manage his business, a spare parts shop. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts to sell, and will help James to generate greater profits and help maintain a constant supply. James hopes that in the future he will be able to complete a house. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 35 years old, married and has four children. She manages a store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She usually earns about P5,000 each month and uses her income as revolving capital and for her children's school allowance.

She hopes to increase her sales but had insufficient fund that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, and soap to sell. This will help meet all customers' needs who come to buy merchandise in her store.

In the future, Elena hopes to become succesful in the retail business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, and soap to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband have been rice farmers for more than 20 years now.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. This will help Jocelyn and her husband improve their farm's productivity and yield.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business a success, save for the schooling of her children, and repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Santa Terecita-32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA TERECITA-32 está compuesto por once integrantes, ocho mujeres y tres varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Erika tiene 21 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en una populosa feria de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Erika va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Erika enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Erika se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a todas sus compañeras de grupo ya que son personas que trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
Santa Terecita-32 Communal Bank is made up of eleven members, eight women and three men.  The president of the bank is Erika, 21.  She makes a living selling clothing in her stall in a busy fair in the city of Cochabamba.

This loan is Erika's first sequence with the institution.  She going to use it to buy clothing wholesale for her business.  She's requesting this loan because she needs the capital.

The challenge Erika faces in her business is the daily competition.  She's going to use the profits to continue improving her sales stall.  Her goal for her business is to have merchandise stocked so she can offer her customers a variety of products.
 
Erika's happy and she's grateful to the institution for the support it gives her and all her fellow group members, because they're people who work hard to get their families ahead.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing wholesale

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
