Agustina is 41 years old and has two school-age children. As a way of gaining income, Agustina runs a small variety store, while her husband cultivates their farm land. She aims to improve her variety store by acquiring more commodities to sell, but she has inadequate capital. 

Thus, she is asking for an additional 5,000 PHP to buy more stock of soft drinks, snack foods, canned goods, eggs, noodles, beverages, seasonings, and frozen foods to sell. She hopes that her loan will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Hismenia

texts.es:
La señora Hismenia trabaja como mesera, su nivel de educación es secundaria, vive en casa familiar ocupando 2  habitaciones en un acabado fino  y piso de machimbre en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Hismenia trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de sus dos hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material escolar para sus dos hijos que están en el colegio.

El sueño de Hismenia es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y salgan profesionales.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Hismenia works as a waitress. She has a secondary education and lives in the family home, occupying 2 rooms with finished walls and a tongue and groove floor, in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

Hismenia works 8 hours a day to cover the food, light, water and education expenses for her two children. She needs the loan to purchase school materials for her two children, who are in school.

Hismenia’s dream is for her two children to finish their studies and become professionals.

This is her first time with IMPRO and her first time with Kiva.
.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her two children since classes already started.

loans.name: Karla Azucena

texts.es:
Karla Azucena de 36 años de edad, casada con tres hijos de 13, 9,2 años. Originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de central de la región. Karla se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora responsable, con ganas de superación personal; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar enfermería profesional.
Gracia a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos varios como, reloj de pared, carros plásticos, sonajeros, vasos de porcelanas, papel de regalo, bolsas de regalo, lámpara de noche,  álbum de fotos, calculadoras, cuadro de pared. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace  ocho años, en unos de los mercados de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos varios, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Karla Azucena agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas  kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Karla Azucena, 36 years old, is married with 3 children of 13, 9, and 2 years old. She is originally from Managua, a place that is located in the central area of the region. Karla is known for being a responsible working woman, wanting to succeed. Unfortunately, because of the lack of financial resources she could not pursue university studies, but she would have liked very much to study for the profession of nurse.

Because of her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead she works selling various products such as wall clocks, plastic cars, rattles, porcelain glasses, wrapping paper, gift bags, night lamps, photo albums, calculators and pictures for the wall. She has been doing this activity for eight years in one of the local markets. 

She will use the loan to invest in working capital to buy various products, so that in the not too far off future she can obtain better earnings. Karla Azucena is grateful for the support the Kiva lenders have provided to people of scare resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy  various products such as wall clocks, plastic cars, rattles, porcelain glasses, wrapping paper, gift bags, night lamps, photo albums, calculators and pictures for the wall.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 44-year-old married woman—and mother of two children—from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a vegetable farming business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the vegetables.
 
In the future, Jocelyn dreams of improving her farming business and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the vegetables.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 34 years old, from Naivasha, and is married to Irene. They have four children who are in school.

James have been in the transport business for the past six years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LTD  after paying his previous loans successfully. He hopes to use the loan amount to repair his motorcycle and use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to expand his business and buy a car in the near future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Gladys has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells eggs, soap, and other everyday needs. 

To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for her shop. This will help Gladys to generate greater profits, increase her returns, and start another business. Gladys hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Gladys is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gladys who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 32 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a fruits and vegetables retail business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, onions, palm oil, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old and a business lady. She is married to John. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past year with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET client. 

The client will use the loan to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses, and skirts for sale. She intends to put the anticipated income back into the business. 


Grace’s hopes and dreams are to expand her clothes selling business and improve on her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 36, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She and her partner Rey, a worker, care for their children and manage their household while operating a business. At this time, Thelma is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Thelma operates a repacking business. She buys products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. She also sews. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Thelma is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy products like garlic, pepper, laurel, and candies. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Thelma dreams that her business will get bigger, and she hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like garlic, pepper, laurel, and candies for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Stella successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Stella's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 28 years old and lives happily with his family. He still operates his tea hawking business, and his monthly income has increased to 13,500 KES.  

Ernest is now requesting a loan of 25,000 KES; this is his second loan with KADET LTD. Ernest wishes to purchase more green tea leaves for resale.  The profits he earns will be reinvested in his current business.

His dream is to grow his business and build a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. She engages in a retail business, buying and selling bananas and taro. She has been in this business for 12 years now, and it is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer.

Imelda is requesting a loan to buy bananas and taro. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy produce and sell it in her store.

In the future, Imelda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana and taro for sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 30 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Rukoki region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Alex has been working hard to manage his agrochemical business, which sells seed fertilizers. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to acquire more stock of agrochemicals, and will help Alex to generate greater profits, which will lead to increased returns and enable him to start another business. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to employ people to help him run the business. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to acquire more stock of agrochemicals

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a kind and friendly woman who has a small fuel business in her village, which is located along the highway. Joy earned the capital to start her fuel business by milling rice.

Joy is in her 40s, married, and has two children, whom she sends to high school and college. Joy’s husband is a seaman. Every time her husband sends her money, she invests it for an additional source of income. 

Joy hopes to prosper in her business and help her children finish college so they can become professionals someday. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy fuel to sell. Through her income from her business, she is able to provide her family's daily basic necessities and provide her children some allowance for school.

loans.use: to buy fuel to sell.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a 41-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol and the mother of five children. She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than 10 years now. She is also in the rice farming business.

Lyra is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soap and toiletries. Lyra believes that this loan could help her in expanding her business and in making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Aziz's Group

texts.en:
Aziz is a young Iraqi woman. She 19 years old and recently married. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Aziz is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs to build the foundation of a new family.

She has two years experience with small home-based sewing work, and she is ambitious to make it a successful one. Learning from her mother's experience as well as introducing a fresh, younger take on her creations, she would like to offer really good service for her customers and give them a variety of services and creative choices for their orders. She would like to buy a new overlock sewing machine, an ironing board and as much nice, good quality fabrics and raw materials as she can. To be able to pay for these purchases she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new overlock sewing machine, an ironing board and some nice, good quality fabrics and raw materials

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Magdalena, 53, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to William, a security guard, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Magdalena is a rice dealer. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Magdalena dreams of having her own rice store and hopes to have a good life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Photographe de profession et cela depuis 2007, Kodjo est un jeune homme de 26ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant en charge. Il fait son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter une moto d’occasion afin de vite répondre aux besoins des clients. A l’avenir, il veut développer son studio et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Kodjo, aged 26, has been working as a professional photographer since 2007.  He is single with no children to support.  He is taking a second loan from WAGES to buy a used motorcycle, which will help him to quickly respond to his clients' needs.  In the future, he would like to develop his studio and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Kasese region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 14 years, Frank has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other items. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay rent for the shop and also to buy more commodities to sell. This will help Frank to generate greater profits and increase the family's income. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to be more productive. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to pay rent for the shop and also to buy more commodities to sell.

loans.name: Mélé

texts.fr: Mélé  est une jeune femme de 32ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Elle est commerçante de profession et vend des pagnes et des parfums dans la zone portuaire depuis 2011. Le premier crédit sollicité à WAGES lui servira d’acheter des marchandises (pagnes et parfums) afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité par l’ouverture d’une boutique et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Mélé, aged 32, is a young woman who is single with no children to support.  She works in retail and has been selling perfumes and "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) in the harbor area since 2011.  She is taking her first loan with WAGES, and will use it to buy some merchandise (pagnes and perfumes) in order to better meet her customers' needs.  She wants to reinvest in her business by opening a shop.  She also wants to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy some perfumes and "pagnes".

loans.name: Development Iii Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Development III” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a diamond miner and they have four children - one in primary school and three in secondary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for eight years, she sells market-food such as rice, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper and dried fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy goods at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, onions, margi, salt, pepper and dried fish at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is a 41-year-old single man who has been working selling mobile phones, accessories and recharge cards since 2008. In 2012 he opened his own mobile selling shop, to improve his living and increase his income. His business is developing slowly, that's why Kazem has to increase his product diversity to respond better to his customers needs.
Kazem is a hard working man who puts so much effort into pleasing his customers and developing his business. Because of the lack of cash, he applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase his stock of mobile recharge cards in order to increase his income and develop his business. He has many future plans, and he will try his best to make them come true. He is planning to open a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock of mobile recharge cards in order to increase his income and develop his business.

loans.name: Siilegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Siilegmaa is a 48-year-old widow. She lives with her three daughters and a son in a house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her daughters, Nansalmaa, age 22, and Otgontuya, age 18, are university students. Ijiltuya, age 12, and son, Suhbat, age 16, go to local schools. 

Siilegmaa has been working at a local power plant for 27 years, and she also runs a small retail business in her off-duty time. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay her daughters' university tuition fees and to cover their living expenses in the city. 

Siilegmaa  is a hardworking, strong and goal-oriented woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughters' university tuition fees and to cover their living expenses in the city.

loans.name: Leslis Otilia

texts.es:
Leslis es una mujer emprendedora de 38 años de edad, maestra de educación primaria que educa y enseña día a día el pan del saber a los niños de su comunidad con una gran experiencia en esta rama por mas de 12 años. Ella cuenta con el apoyo moral y económico de su esposo con el cual tiene 2 hijos en el área agrícola es específicamente en la producción y cultivo de café juntos tiene un hogar bien formado y estructurado ya que con su esposo e hijos realiza actividades para un mejor bienestar económico y familiar. Ella aprendió y se dedica fuera de sus actividades escolares al cultivo y producción de café hace 10 años misma actividad enseñada por sus padres que ayudaron a que ella cumpliera su meta de ser maestra de educación. Ella es una mujer que ante sus vecinos familiares y amigos se ha caracterizado por su gran trayectoria como mujer trabajadora, luchadora, responsable y honesta.

Hoy en día Solicita ayuda para mejorar su producción cafetalera comprando abono, bombas de fumigación y otros elementos que hacen del cultivo de café mas sano y productivo para su venta en el mercado local ya que de esa manera podrá obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.

Su sueño es poder educar a sus hijos con una buena carrera universitaria que haga de ellos mejores hombres y mujeres cada día para que así ellos puedan tener el conocimiento para crear negocios o empresas que generen empleo y sean mejores cada día que pasa  generar empleo.
texts.en:
Leslis, 38, is an enterprising woman and primary school teacher who educates and teaches the bread of knowledge every day to the children of her community.  She has a lot of experience in this field, more than 12 years.

She has the moral and economic support of her husband in the the field of agriculture, specifically growing and producing coffee.

She and her husband have two children.  Together they have a well-formed and structured household because with her husband and children she does things for to improve her economic and family well-being.  Outside of her teaching activities, she learned coffee growing and production 10 years ago, the same activity taught by her parents who helped her achieve her goal of being a teacher of education.

She's known among her neighbors, relatives, and friends for her long career as a hardworking, determined, responsible, and honest woman.

Today she's requesting a loan to improve her coffee crop by buying fertilizer, fumigation pumps, and other things that make the crop healthier and more productive to sell in the local market.  This way she'll be able to get a better income for her family.

Her dream is to be able to educate her children with a good university education that will make them better men and women every day.  This way they'll have the knowledge to create businesses or companies that generate jobs and they'll be better every day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and irrigation pumps for her coffee crop

loans.name: Kyatoko Tutungure Group

texts.en:
Brian is 58 years old and married with four children.  He lives in Nyakashaka – Kyatoko, Rukungiri District. For a long time, Brian has been an agriculturalist whose products range from farm products to produce, like coffee and bananas, plus maize processed into maize flour for the consumption of the community he lives in.

Brian is one of the members of Kyatoko – Tutungure Group, and he has been able to sustain his family through the sale of his agricultural and farm products.

Brian is requesting this loan through UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to buy more organic fertilizers for his plantations of tomatoes and plantain, which will in turn help him to improve and expand his agricultural enterprise. If he succeeds, he will be able to save money for his family and future investments.

He also urges UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to reduce the interest rate and increase the initial loan amount of the first cycle of group borrowers.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Lizandra

texts.en: Lizandra is 50 years of age and married with one child. She manages a shop where she offers different cellphones and accessories. She has been running this kind of business for 19 years. Lizandra is still not satisfied with the flow of her business that's why she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to allow her to purchase different cellphones and cellphone accessories for her retail stall. She hopes to increase her income which will help to improve her family's living conditions. Lizandra believes that her success in life relies on her hard work and wise business management.

loans.use: to purchase different cellphones and cellphone accessories for her retail stall

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto's guiding principle is hard work and determination. This guiding principle pushes him to strive for the best.

Roberto has been running his shop for 30 years. He is married with four children. Roberto aspires to have a stable source of income. He is seeking a loan of 10,000 PHP to allow him to buy stocks of cellphones and cellphone accessories. He knows that through this requested loan amount he will make a better income which will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and cellphone accessories for his retail stall.

loans.name: Donald José

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón un pueblito muy pequeñito, luchador en el comercio, en los tiempos anteriores la mayoría de los ciudadano sobrevivían emigrando a otros países, hoy en día dependen de su mismo pueblo, debido a que han descubierto a que existe diferentes tipos de mina para explotar como es, mina de oro y mina yesera son las que en la actualidad está funcionando al desarrollo de los pequeños comerciantes. 

Es aquí donde habita el joven Donald José luchador por su vida donde se dedica a brindarle enseñanza a estudiantes de la primaria, pero son de sus sueños poder llegar a mejorar su vivienda, pero según el esto lo puede lograr a través de un crédito que le financie ceprodel y Kivas. 

Hoy en día se entero que Ceprodel Y Kiva apoyaba a este tipo de persona, por tal Razón Solicita un crédito para la compra de: Cemento, Arena y pago de mano de Obra, Esto sería de gran importancia de aprovecharían a mejorar un poco las paredes de su vivienda por lo que se encuentran deteriorada y le dará un pequeño repello debido a que no es el alcance de su bolsillo volverlas a construir. 

 Agradece Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le sigan dando la mano amigable para seguir adelante en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñon is a little town that is fighting for business. In past times, the majority of its citizens survived by emigrating to other countries. Now they depend on their own town, thanks to the fact that they have discovered that there exist different kinds of mines to exploit, such as gold and gypsum mines, which are those that now are functioning to develop small business people.

It is here that the young Donald José lives, striving for his livelihood by offering instruction to primary students, but his dream is to be able to improve his house. According to him, he can manage to do this through a loan from CEPRODEL and Kiva. 

Now he has learned that CEPRODEL and Kiva support this type of person, and for that reason he is applying for a loan to purchase cement and sand and pay for labor. This will be of great importance to take advantage of this to improve the walls of his house a little because they are deteriorated, and he will give them a little plastering, since it is beyond his means to rebuild them.

He appreciates CEPRODEL and Kiva because they continue to give him a friendly hand to continue forward in his family life.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, age 33 and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a security guard and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Aida hopes to expand her business and to have a rice store. She dreams of having a comfortable life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a 49-year-old, married woman. Her husband is a farmer, and they are blessed with five children.

To earn a living, Benita offers different kinds of vegetables for sale within her local community. She explains that she has been in this line of business for one year.

Benita would like to increase her stocks of bananas, bitter gourds and eggplants, but she has insufficient capital to do so. As a result, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP. She hopes to obtain this loan amount so that she can improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to expand and improve her vending business by purchasing additional bananas, eggplants, and bitter gourds

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a 52-year-old married woman. She and her husband have seven children, and they reside in San Miguel, Bohol.

To earn a living, she is engaged in vegetable farming. She explains that she has been in this business for more than five years now, and that it is her primary source of her income.

Mariana is asking for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. With the loan proceeds, she expects to grow more and higher-quality vegetables than she is able to grow now. In the future, Mariana hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming business by purchasing vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en: Patricio, 43, is a father who is raising his family in a rural community. Aside from farming, he also operates a jeepney to carry passengers and deliver their farm products to market. He aims to continue using his jeepney to earn income but he does not have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for an additional 5,000 PHP to buy wheels and gasoline and pay to register his jeepney. He believes that someday, he will improve his family's living conditions and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wheels and gasoline and pay to register his jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many goods for resale in his shop (rice, beans, soap etc)

loans.name: Good Women Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Good Women” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan in the amount of 500,000 SLL for each woman in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profits, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kumba. Kumba was born in the Sandor, in eastern Sierra Leone, 38 years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are currently attending primary and secondary schools. Kumba has been selling ready-to-wear goods, such as clothing and shoes, for many years now. With her share of this loan, she plans on buying additional cloth, clothes, shoes, and other goods in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to expand and increase her business's inventory by purchasing additional goods such as cloth, clothes, and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a 32-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three children (ages 14, 11 an two years old).

To earn a living, she is engaged in the rice farming business. She helps her husband till their lot.

Marietta is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizers and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Marietta hopes to expand her business and to save money for their children's education.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming operations by purchasing additional fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is Rita. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more products and goods for her variety store. She has been running her business for six years now, and she proudly explains that it continues to grow. She and her husband, who is a driver, work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to secure another 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her existing inventory. In her view, the more items displayed at the store, the better. This is because additional items will result in increased profits. Profits from the business help her cover the family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this potential infusion of capital with happiness and gratitude in her heart.

Rita dreams of operating a grocery store in the future, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly, where she can share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., groceries, toiletries, and beverages).

loans.name: Marc

texts.en: Marc is a 41-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Marc started selling lights in October 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Truman

texts.es:
Truman es un hombre de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el distrito de Aguaytia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Truman no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Truman trabaja en su pequeña parcela donde cultiva plátano y cacao, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y cuidados.
Truman se encuentra agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, de esta manera Truman podrá darle un buen mantenimiento y obtendrá una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos y desea verlos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Truman, 40, lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Aguaytia district with his wife and three children who he loves and are his main reason for living. He is a very nice, hard working and enthusiastic person. He and his wife spend all their energy on getting their family ahead. 

Unfortunately due to poor economic resources, and because he had to start working at a very young age, Turman was not able to study agronomy. But he would have like to have done it very much. 

In his free time he likes to play with his kids and sometimes he makes a delicious ceviche [seafood dish] to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Truman works on his small parcel of land where he cultivates bananas and cacao. He works every day for approximately eight hours and he believes it is going well due to his experience and expertise.

Truman is thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help given he can buy fertilizer for his crops. 

This way Truman can maintain his crops and have a good harvest. He will keep working and strive to achieve his dream of giving his children a good education and seeing them succeed as professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Taalaibubu

texts.ru: Таалайбубу 55 лет, воспитала пятерых детей, старшему сыну 26 лет. С 1989 года Таалайбубу занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 500 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Таалайбубу имеется 2 дойная корова с теленком, 10 овец и 2 лошади приносящих около 11,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Таалайбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на дополнительных голов коров, для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Таалайбубу планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для реконструкции сарая, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Taalaibubu is 55 years old.  She has raised five children. Her oldest son is now 26 years old. Taalaibubu has been involved in animal husbandry since 1989 and started in this business with an initial capital of 500 som (KGS).  Her farming business now includes two dairy cows, a calf, ten sheep and two horses.  She makes about 11,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk, dairy products and the resale of livestock.

In order to further develop her farming business, Taalaibubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to purchase additional cows, in order to increase her income from the sale of milk.  She plans to use part of her earnings from this loan to buy construction materials (to rebuild her barn) while the rest will be used in the future, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en: Restituto is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children aged 5, 4 and 2. Restituto has been in the rice farming business for more than five years. Restituto is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Restituto hopes to be able to improve his business in the future and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is 32 years old. She is a single and hard working lady. She has operated a beauty salon in the township of Bomet for the last six years, making a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She learnt about KADET LTD from a credit officer who was doing some marketing in the area. 

She has applied for a second loan of 20,000 KES after successfully paying off her previous loan. The loan will assist her to acquire beauty products such as braids and hair weaves. She plans to use the anticipated profits to restock her boutique.

Her dream is to start a hairdressing school.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as hair weaves and braids.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is still in the business of designing clothes and her business is doing well. She now earns a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family. Pauline is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after she successfully repaid her first loan. She is happy with the financial services KADET and KIVA lenders have offered her.

She intends to use the loan to purchase more fabric materials and sewing threads. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child and add more stock. Her hope is to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric materials and sewing threads

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 47-year-old married man, and a father of three children. He has been working as a tailor for fifteen years. He also sells men's suits to increase his income and improve his standard of living. 
Kamal has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six loan cycles, all of which were invested in improving his standard of living and covering his family's needs. The present loan will be invested for the same purpose. Kamal wants to attract new customers.
Kamal is very optimistic concerning this loan, and he is sure that it will come with a positive feedback on both his social and financial living.

loans.use: To buy fabric to develop his business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 47-year-old mother who has four children. Despite being widowed, she has the determination to uplift their status of living. She has owned and managed a variety store in her community for almost 10 years. She aims to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy sugar, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to sell. She believes that someday, she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 38 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married to Jackline. They have three children aged between 1 and 10.

Meshack has been in the transport business for the past five years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. after repaying his previous loan successfully. He hopes to use the loan amount to buy a motorbike.

He hopes to own several motorbikes in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 46 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She has two children. For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her clothing store.

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and increase the stock in the business. Mariam hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda grows various vegetables in her field. She always goes in the field to assure that her planted vegetables are in good condition. Imelda sells her vegetables in the market after harvesting. Sometimes, she sells them in high volumes to the buyers who buy products in their village. 

Imelda is 47 years old, married and has three children. Her child who is in college is temporarily not attending school because of a financial shortage. At present, she only sends to school her two children who are in high school and the elementary level of education. 

Imelda wants to grow more vegetables in the farm to gain additional income. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy seeds and fertilizers to apply to her vegetables. She hopes to gain more profit and be able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to apply to her vegetables.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 57-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice-farming business for more than 30 years now, together with her husband.

Susana is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Susana hopes that this loan could help her in expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Nichilas

texts.en:
Nichilas is 42 years old. He is an industrious gentleman, married, and a father of three children, aged 15, 13, and 6 years respectively. He is a mixed farmer who grows various crops on his own piece of land as well as practicing a livestock trade.

He learned about KADET LTD. from a marketing activity carried out in his area. He has acquired a second loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) after he successfully paid off the previous loan. The loan will assist him to pay for labor for land cultivation as well as to buy additional cows for fattening and resale at a profit.

He plans to use anticipated profits to put up a better housing unit for his family in a newly bought piece of land. His hopes and dreams are to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to pay for labor for land cultivation and to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Dora Belen

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y su pequeño bebé recién nacido, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Dora no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar diversos potajes para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de sus hermanos, Dora trabaja en su pequeña parcela, donde cultiva yuca, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 7 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y experiencia.
Dora se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono y herbicidas para su cultivo, de esta manera ella espera tener una buena cosecha para venderla a un buen precio, así pues Dora seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una juguería y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dora is a 23 year old young woman, she lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and her small newborn baby.  She is very kind, hard working and enthusiastic, channeling all her efforts to getting ahead.  Regrettably, due to lack of financial resource and the need to work at a very young age, Dora was not able to go to school and become a professional, something which she would have very much liked to do.  In her spare time she likes to prepare various soups and stews to share with her family.
With a lot of determination, dedication and thanks to the support of her brothers, Dora works her small field where she grows yucca.  She works about 7 hours every day and believes that she is doing well given her responsibilities and experience.
Dora is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, through their help she will be able to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for her crops.  This way she plans to have a good harvest which she will be able to sell at a good price.  In this manner Dora will continue to work and strive to achieve her dream of owning a juicery and slowly getting ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El sauce un pequeño municipio donde se ha caracterizado como una zona ganadera, es aquí donde vive  Julio. 

Julio cuenta con su propia actividad ganadera, donde su principal actividad es la producción de leche, pero para esto el cliente necesita darle una buena alimentación balanceada a su ganado  anudándole para sobre vivir en la época de verano, por condiciones de pasto no cuenta con una buena alimentación. 

Hoy en día se entero que Ceprodel Y Kiva apoyaba a este tipo de persona, por tal Razón Solicita un crédito para la compra de: de pacas para la alimentación de ganado ya que con esto sería de mucha importancia para poder mantener la producción de leche y así darle una mejor vida a sus tres hijitos que tanto ama y estima. 

 Agradece Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le sigan dando la mano amigable para seguir adelante en su vida familiar.
texts.en: El Sauce, a small village in an area known for its cattle ranching, is where Julio lives. Julio runs his own cattle raising operation, which specializes in dairy production. In order to meet the expectations of his customers, he has to provide his herd with a balanced diet that prepares them for the summer when there is very little good grass available for them to eat. When he learned that Ceprodel and Kiva offer assistance to people in his situation, he decided to take out a loan to buy hay in order to keep his cattle fed. This will be essential in allowing him to keep producing dairy and thus provide a better life for his three young children, who he loves and cares for so much. He thanks Ceprodel and Kiva for lending him a helping hand in improving his family's life.

loans.use: to buy hay to feed his cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años,  esta casada con James con quien tiene 03 hijos de 14, 12  y 07 años, vive en junto a su familia en la casa que construyo con mucho esfuerzo.El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de comida, jugos y desayunos, todos los días , por eso sale muy temprano a vender sus jugos en la vereda de su casa y por las tardes arma su mesita y comienza con la preparación de sus exquisitas comidas, lleva realizando este trabajo por un año y le esta yendo muy bien, como toda mujer con ganas de superarse tiene muchos objetivos, pero el principal es el de lograr consolidarse en su trabajo  y así mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar en donde realiza su trabajo.Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP Y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera responsable y puntual .Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes como arroz, hojas de bijao, huevos entre otros, insumos y materiales para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria, age 43, is married to James with whom she has three children, ages 14, 12, and seven. The family lives in the house that they built with their own hands. Maria's work consists of selling food items, juices, and breakfast every day. She goes out very early to sell juices in the areas around her house and in the afternoons she gets to work preparing her delicious food. She's been doing this work for a year and it's going very well. Like every ambitious woman, she has many goals, but her top priority is managing to shore up her business, and thus makes certain home improvements, as she works from home.     

This will be her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she's very happy knowing she can count on some financial support, as she already feels more secure in her ability to build up her business. She is committed to meeting her regular payments in a timely and responsible manner. With the 1,000 soles she is seeking in this loan, she will buy the ingredients she needs to do her work such as rice, banana leaves, and eggs, among others.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, eggs, olives, and others.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 57, a resident of Casibarag, Isabela. She is married to Apolonio, her business partner, and a father to her children. She and her husband are managing their own business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria owns the operations of their motorcycle transportation business. She has a one motor unit, for which they are paid a boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 7,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her motor unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and materials needed for her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and married with three kids (nine, two and 11 months), who are living with her in Cangmohao, Siquijor, Siquijor.

She has been running a general store business for ten years and earns 7,000 PHP a month towards their living expenses.

She's a new member of PMPC, who has good credit records and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 Pesos to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 33 years old and has four school-age children. She and her husband are striving hard to earn a living and satisfy their family needs. 

Her husband cultivates their farm land, while Leticia engages in fish vending to supplement her husband's income. 

She aims to improve the business and increase her income, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of fish to sell. 

She is hoping this loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and has one child, who attends elementary school. 

She has been running her sari-sari store business for nine years. Arlene has been steadily growing her small store over the years of managing her business.

Arlene dreams that her sari-sari store will become a grocery store someday. She is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy grocery items, like condiments, drinks, breads and powder milk for babies. 

She hopes to increase her profit, which she will use to improve the business and help her achieve her dream someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, like condiments, drinks, breads and milk for babies.

loans.name: Kipyegon

texts.en:
Kipyegon is 24 years old, single and supports no-one. His main source of income is the buying and selling of dry maize and he has been in this business for a period of two years, achieving an income of KES 12,000.

He has just requested his first loan of KES 15,000 with KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase dry maize for resale. The profit he gets will be used to repay the loan.  

His dream is to diversify his current business and start a poultry farm.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale

loans.name: Oyuntogtoh

texts.en:
Mrs Oyuntogtoh is 37 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. 

Her husband, Mendbayar, aged 42 works at a local company. Her sons, Bahimbor, aged 16 and Borbandi, aged 15 study at the local secondary school and her daughters, Ariungua, aged five and Anungua, aged one go to the local kindergarten. 

The borrower has been running her tailoring service at home since 2003. She has just started her organic vegetable and fruit retail business at a rental counter of a local retail street. 

She is now requesting 1,300,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables and fruits to sell at her counter. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and well-behaved woman.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables and fruits to sell at her counter

loans.name: J.nepo

texts.en:
J. Nepo is a 26-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. 

J. Nepo started selling lights in June, 2011 and he has sold 150 lights to date, providing clean energy to 700 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Panglao, Bohol. 

She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her community. 

Gina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, rice, biscuits, soap and toiletries and to pay for the school expenses of her children.

Gina is optimistic that one day she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, candies, rice, biscuits, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old from Nyahururu and is married to Beth. They have three children, who are in school.

Daniel has been in the barber business for the past ten years. He has applied for his first loan through KADET LTD to enable him buy more barber machines and chemicals.

He hopes to expand his business by opening many other barber shops in the near future.

loans.use: To buy barber machines and chemicals.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of one child and her only child goes to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (her parents). 

She sells fruit and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 12 years. She sells to all knds of people on a retail basis for seven days a week.  

She has applied for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy boxes of pineapples, tomatoes, pawpaws, greens and onions. Her major business challenges include seasonality and high transportation costs. 

She is hoping to get a track to transport fruit and vegetables from villages to the market and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onions, greens, pawpaws and pineapples

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy wood for a furniture making business

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Purevsuren is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband Amarsaihan, age 49, works at a local private company. Her daughter Bathishig, age 23, works at a local company as an accountant and son Chimeddorj, age 16, studies at a local secondary school. Purevsuren has been running her organic dairy products business at a local market since 2006. She has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase larger quantities of organic dairy products to sell at her rental counter. She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of organic dairy products to sell at her rental counter.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 51 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in a small village of the Tetritskaro District. Roman requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
Roman has a tractor and serves local people in cultivating their agricultural land to earn an income. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.
Roman requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credits Roman will trade livestock. He plans to purchase sheep and cows at wholesale prices and then resell them with a price markup. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and cows.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Mrs. Oyungerel is 36 years old and lives with her husband and 3 sons in a ger in the Darhan province of Mongolia. Her husband Monhbat helps his wife with their organic vegetable retail business at a local market. Her sons Ulsbold, age 7, goes to a local primary school and Torbold, age 4, and Irmuun, age 5, go to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been running her organic vegetable retail business since 2002. She has gained a lot of experience and the customers' trust over the years. She is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase larger amounts of organic vegetables to sell at her rental counter. She is a hardworking, active and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of organic vegetables to sell at her rental counter.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a fish vendor from Baclayon, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Maria needs additional capital for the improvement of her business. Maria is applying for a loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Maria hopes of making her business a successful and sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda  tiene  29  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos, fumigantes, y a su vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella piensa dar mantenimiento a las plantaciones, para que este no sufra ningún daño, y no se pierda la producción, y así con su proyecto cafetalero poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra,  ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Yolanda, 29, is married and lives with her husband and two children.  She will use the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and fumigation products, and hire workers.  Her plan is to provide maintenance for her crops to protect them from harm and avoid production loss.  Her aim is to generate more profit from her coffee plantation to contribute to the family.  Since she does not have sufficient capital to make the purchase because of her low income, she is requesting a loan, which is her first through FUDECOSUR.  She has never received any other state bank loans and FUDECOSUR is giving her better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Victor Paul

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 66 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Víctor pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, la cual ejerció por un largo tiempo y ahora ya está jubilado.
Actualmente Víctor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de medicina natural, él trabaja en pequeños mercados de su ciudad ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulatoria, él puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Víctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de medicina natural, de esta manera él tendrá su negocio mejorar abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues Víctor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Victor is 66 years old and lives in the city of Huaraz with his wife.  He has two children, both of whom are now adults.  He loves them both and they are his main reason for living.  Victor is a friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person and, along with his wife, they put all their efforts into trying to prosper.  Thanks to his hard work, Victor was able to study to become a teacher and this was his profession for a long time, but he is now retired.

Victor currently has a small business selling natural medicines.  He works in small markets in the city as a street vendor.  He can work for around 10 hours a day and thinks the work is going well because of the friendly service he gives to customers.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, because of the help provided, he will be able to buy a larger quantity and variety of natural medicines.  This way he will be able to keep his business better stocked and serve more customers.  Victor will continue working and putting in the effort to achieve his great dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es casada y tiene un hijo , vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Corpaputo en la localidad de Achacachi.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel de primaria y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche en su comunidad.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y así mejorar su producción lechera.
El sueño de Elizabeth es tener una producción de leche continua y segura.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has one child.  She lives at her parents' house in the Corpaputo community in the town of Achacachi.
Elizabeth studied up to primary school level and now makes a living producing milk in the community.
She needs this loan to buy a dairy cow so as to improve production.
Elizabeth's dream is to have a continuous and stable production of milk.
This is the first time Elizabeth has applied for a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and improve her income.

loans.name: Maria Pia

texts.es:
María es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, María se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, María trabaja como asistente en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 9 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus prácticas académicas y mejorar sus métodos de estudios, así pues María seguirá trabajando y estudiando para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional y así poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
María, 19, is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings.  She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person with a great desire to prosper.  Thanks to her efforts and help from her parents, Marís is earning a degree in Business Administration.  In her free time, she enjoys dancing and sometimes cooking a delicious chicken and rice dish to share with family.

On her own initiative, and through much work and dedication, María works as an assistant at a company in the city.  She works an average nine hours every day and believes that things are going well for her because of her good performance and kindness toward others

María is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a computer.  This will help her carry out her academic tasks and improve her study methods, allowing her to work and study in order to become a good professional and get ahead, little by litte.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Cochi Lipe en la localidad de Achacachi.
El estudio hasta el nivel de Secundaria y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche en su comunidad.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar un par de vacas lecheras y así mejorar su producción lechera y por ende, sus ingresos.
El sueño de Javier es tener una producción de leche continua y segura para poder mantener a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Javier is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house, which is in the Cochin Lipe community in the town of Achacachi.
He studied up to secondary school level and currently makes a living producing milk in his community.
He needs this loan to buy a couple of dairy cows so as to improve production and, consequently, his income.
Javier's dream is to have continuous and stable production of milk so he can maintain his family.
This is the second time Javier has applied for a loan from Impro, and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a couple of dairy cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es separado y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos esta en etapa universitaria, viven en casa en alquiler, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente  es empleado público; los días domingos el vende zapatos de cholita en una de las  la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto; así cubre los gastos familiares.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir más zapatos de tal manera que su capital de trabajo aumentará y también sus ingresos por las ventas.
El sueño de Elias es convertirse en un distribuidor a nivel nacional.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elías is divorced and has two children, one of whom studies at the university.  They live in a rented house in the residential area of Villa Esperanza in the city of El Alto.

He received a high school education and is a public employee.  On Sundays, he sells regional style shoes at the fairs in El Alto to help cover household expenses.  The loan he is requesting is to buy more shoes to increase his working capital and income.  Elías wants to become a national distributor.

This is his third loan through IMPRO and first from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy more regional style "cholita" shoes to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Magdonal

texts.es: Magdonal, tiene la edad 43 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra  de cerdos. Lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Magdonal, 43, is married and lives with his wife and three children.  He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and wants to give them concentrated feed to speed up their fattening.  Once they reach their ideal weight will sell them at the local market or nearby villages.  His aim is to generate more income for his and his parents' welfare, and expand in the pig raising business.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan and FUDECOSUR is giving him better loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa, de 22 años de edad, esta casada con Ricardo quien es comerciante y padre de su hija de 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan la casa de su suegra.La actividad que realiza Melissa es la venta de productos variados como víveres, utensilios,ropa entre otros. Todos estos productos los compra al por mayor en los centros comerciales y los vende a los comerciantes de su localidad, brindado créditos de pago mínimo diario. Se inició en éste negocio por iniciativa de su suegra quien le brindó el capital y su cartera de clientes. Tiene más de 02 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo continúa haciendo sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y puede contar con una ocupación, que le permite sentirse productiva, deseando asi convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Por tanto, tiene planes de abrir un puesto de ventas en la casa de su suegra y exhibir su mercadería variada.Este será el préstamo número 04 con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado de  S/.2500 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería variada para tener productos disponibles para sus clientes como balones de gas, platos , entre otros.
texts.en:
Twenty-two year old Melissa is married to Ricardo, a shopkeeper and the father of her two year old daughter.  They live together in Melissa's mother-in-law's house.  Melissa makes a living selling various products such as provisions, utensils and clothes.  She buys all these products in bulk from the shopping centres and then sells them to local businessmen, who pay in daily installments.  Melissa started this business with help from her mother-in-law who provided capital and a customer log.  She has now been doing this work for over two years and, for now, she continues to work alone.

Melissa likes the business as it generates an income and it gives her a profession, making her feel productive. She would like to become a prosperous businesswoman and with this in mind, she has plans to open a shop in her mother-in-law's house where she will be able to display her products.  This will be Melissa's fourth loan with Kiva and she is hoping for help so she can continue working towards her objectives.  With the loan of 2500 Nuevo Soles she will buy various products, such as gas and dishes so that they are available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy products for the home.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad 55 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra  de una moto. Lo que pretende realizar la compra de la moto para poder transportarse a la propiedad donde tiene unos novillos ya que la propiedad está bastante lejos de la casa como para ir caminando. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos, 55, is married and lives together with his wife. With this loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle in order to travel more easily to a piece of land where he raises cattle, located too far away to go walking.

Carlos wants his animals to reach a good weight in order to sell them in the local market or in neighboring regions. He wants to make good profits with this activity and increase his wellbeing. 

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had a loan before with a state-owned bank, but FUDECOSUR has granted him the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to go to work.

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth
