texts.es: Doña Mirsa, muy trabajadora a diario busca como salir adelante con su pequeño negocio la venta de cosméticos y ropa para garantizar el desarrollo de sus dos gemelos quienes ya son unos adolecentes, su esposo le apoya con los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos como conductor de cabezales, ella solicita el crédito para invertir nuevamente en el negocio, en esta ocasión necesita comprar variedad de ropa interior y escolar, para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y poco a poco ir mejorando su nivel de vida con la familia.
texts.en: Mirsa works very hard and every day she is looking to move forward with her small business that sells make-up and clothes so that she can ensure that her teenage twin sons can do well.  Mirsa's husband supports her with household costs, with his income from working as a driver.  Mirsa is applying for a loan to invest again in the business.  On this occasion she need to buy a variety of school uniforms and underwear to cover demand and, little by little, to improve her living conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of school uniforms and underwear.

loans.name: Herminia Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Herminia Carolina es casada, tiene 35 años de edad, de escolaridad nivel primario, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales 3 estudian, ella se dedica al comercio, especificamente a la compra y venta de flores para decoraciones, inicio su negocio ayudando a su madre a vender flores, en la actualidad lleva 8 años de experiencia en dicho negocio.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de flores para ampliar su negocio y en el futuro quiere ver su negocio prosperado y tener mas puntos de ventas. Tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien tambien es comerciante.
texts.en:
Herminia Carolina is married.  She is 35 years old and completed primary school.  She has four children, three of whom are studying.  Herminia has a business buying and selling flowers for decoration.  She started her business by helping her mother to sell flowers and she now has eight years experience with this business.

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy flowers to expand her business. In the future she wants the business to prosper and have more sales outlets.  Herminia receives support from her husband who also has a business.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Maria De Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maria de Rosario es casada, de 39 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian, ella se dedica a la sastreria, inicio su negocio trabajando con su tio, actualmente lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una maquina plana para coser, en el futuro cercano ella quiere ver su negocio prosperado y tener trabajadores. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es albañil.
texts.en:
Maria de Rosario is married. She is 39 years old and has six years of primary education. She has 7 children and 3 of them are in school. She is a seamstress and started her business by working with her uncle. Now she has 3 years of experience. 

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy a flat sewing machine. In the near future, she wants to see her business prosper and have employees. She has the support of her husband, who is a bricklayer.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Dona Maria Francisca, Reside en Colonia El Sol en el departamento de Chalatenango al norte del Pais, junto a su esposo de 59 años y sus  hijas que aun estudian (29, 22 y 16 años) y que le ayudan en su actividad de pezca y comercializacion de la misma. La actividad la realiza en una canoa de su propiedad y luego vende su pezca en la zona de residencia y cantones aledaños. Ella solicita el credito para la compra de transmayos (redes para la pezca) y otros insumos necesarios para realizar la actividad.
texts.en: Maria Francisca lives in Colonia El Sol in the department of Chalatenango in the northern part of the country. She lives with her husband, who is 59, and their daughters, aged 29, 22 and 16. They help her in her fishing and fish selling. She does her activity from a canoe that she owns and later she sells her catch in the area where she lives and in nearby communities. She is asking for the loan to buy fishing nets and other materials she need to do her activity.

loans.use: to buy nets and different species of fish.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel de 47 años de edad, vive solo con su compañera de vida y se dedican a la venta de minutas desde hace mas de 27 años, en la zona turistica del muelle del Puerto ubicado en el departamento de la Libertad.Son personas reconocidas por ser muy laboriosas.
Necesita su prestamo para comprar los insumos para la elaboracion de minutas (raspadura de hielo, saborizadas con jarabes, limòn o chile, y con un aderezo de jalea de tamarindo, banano o fresa) que son consumen en lugares de clima caluroso, en barquillos o en vasos.
texts.en:
Miguel is 47 years old. He lives alone with his life companion and they have sold snow cones for more than 27 years in the tourist area of the pier in of the port in the department of La Libertad. They are people who are known for being hard working. 

She needs a loan to buy materials to make snow cones that are flavored with syrups, lemon or chiles, and with a topping of tamarind, bananas or strawberry jam. They are consumed in places with warm climates in cones or in cups.

loans.use: raw materials to make snow cones.

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Selenia, es soltera sus cuatro hijos son independientes y casados, recibe el apoyo económico de su ex esposo para los gastos del hogar, ella ha salido adelante prestando sus servicios de empleada domestica con esos ingresos paga sus créditos los cuales han sido para mejorar su vivienda. Este decimo crédito solicitado es para hacer un cuarto para ella con mejores condiciones aprovechando el espacio en su terreno, necesita comprar materiales como cemento, bloques, arena, hierro, piedrines.
texts.en:
Doña Celenia is not married. Her four children are independent and married. She receives financial support from her ex-husband for household expenses. She makes a living offering her services as a domestic worker. With this income she pays her loans which she has taken out to improve her house.

This is the tenth loan she has taken out, and is to build a room for her with better conditions, taking advantage of the space on her land. To do this she needs to buy materials such as cement, blocks, sand, iron and paving slabs.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, iron, paving slabs.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papas, venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de fruta, venta de lazados, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace ocho años, aprendiendo el oficio de su cuñada, posteriormente decide comprar una máquina de tejer e instaló su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y máquina doble) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE ROSAS” communal bank will begin its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Teodora is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling potatoes, selling food, selling sweaters, selling fruit, selling ribbons and weaving blankets.    

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, among them Teodora. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago. joining at the invitation of a consultant from the institute who went to visit her at her home. Right now, she has a business knitting sweaters. She says that she started this business eight years ago, after deciding to buy a knitting machine and setting it up at her house. 
 
The loan she is taking out now is to increase capital by buying wool and a double machine, which she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of La Paz. She will use it to produce and sell to order. This type of work allows her to support her home as much as possible, because she is married and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy wool and a double machine.

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es: Xinia, tiene la edad 37 de  años, está casada y vive con los dos hijos y el esposo. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. Ella cuenta con las instalaciones por lo que quiere comprar cerdos y el concentrado para el mantenimiento de los mismos. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Xinia is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her two children and husband. With this loan she wants to buy feed to fatten up her pigs. She has the facilities which is why she wants to buy pigs and feed for them. She wants to have her animals at the ideal weight for selling them at the market in her area or nearby places.

She wants to generate a larger income for her own and her family's wellbeing, and to grow with the project of fattening pigs. This is the first loan she has taken out with FUDECOSUR. She has not previously taken out any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs.

loans.name: Seenimi Group

texts.fr:
Mme A.SAFIATA CNIHISSIPOMG est responsable du groupe SEENIMI.  Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 26ans et le moins âgés à 12 ans.  02 vont à l’école  et  elle a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait la restauration et vend aussi l’eau glacée depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz, 01 sachet d’atiéké (couscous de manioc, 01 bidon d’huile et une rangée de bois de chauffe. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son restaurant. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
A. Safiata Cnihissipomg is the leader of the Seenimi group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. The eldest child is 26 years old and the youngest, 12. Two of her children go to school and she has 2 more dependents.

Safiata has a restaurant business and has also been selling iced water for 3 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 packet of "atiéké" (cassava-based couscous), 1 can of oil and a row of firewood. She would like to save her profits so that she can strengthen her restaurant business. She aims to expand her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 1 packet of "atiéké", 1 can of oil and a row of firewood.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 57 years old and a business lady. She is a widowed mother of three. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past 35 years with a monthly income of about KES 50,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET client. 

The client will use the loan to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts to sell. She intends to plow the anticipated income back into the business. Beatrice’s hopes and dreams are to expand her clothes selling business and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shirts, trousers, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en: Jannet is a 34-year-old woman from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Jannet started selling lights in February, 2012, and she has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Basawadima Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Basawadima” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each of them in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Josephine is the featured leader of this group. Josephine is 50 years old and she is married with 5 children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Josephine sells market food - rice, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. With the help of this loan, Josephine will invest in her business by buying rice, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: M. Rose's Group

texts.fr:
Josette fait partie du groupe  Tujimbere et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 21 ans et  est mariée à Yves, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 6 mois.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière  depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son  troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bière  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Avec les gains de son commerce, elle parvient à gagner sa vie en satisfaisant les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Josette is a member of the Tujimbere group and lives in Gitega. She is 21 years old and married to Yves, a builder. The couple have a 6-month-old child. Josette has been selling beer for 5 years. This is her 3rd loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of beer for resale, so that she can earn more money. She manages to earn a living and satisfy the needs of her family using the profits generated by her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beer for resale.

loans.name: Miri

texts.en:
Miri is 51 years old. He is married and lives in Gardabani District with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. Miri requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the small wage earned by Miri working as a guard man. He makes a total of 150 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Miri requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Miri will trade in livestock. He plans to purchase animals at wholesale prices for resale with a price markup. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase animals for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old man from Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  Emmanuel started selling lights in July, 2012, and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a 38-year-old married man and a father of two children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 8 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Vicente is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like tires, nuts, bolts and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like tires, nuts, bolts and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 29-year-old business lady. She is a married mother of two children.  She has been running a salon business for the past six years with a monthly income of about KES 13,500 which she uses to support her family. She also keeps poultry to supplement her income. Agnes is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing client. 

She will use the loan to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions. With the anticipated profits from her salon, she will educate her children and improve her poultry business. Her hopes and dreams are to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, hair oils, weaves and hair extensions.
